IMDb data; ttnr: 1911533, Title: Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes, --- Description: Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes: Directed by Jude Gerard Prest. With Yaz Canli, Kai Cofer, Christopher Karl Johnson, Nikki Muller. In the tradition of PARANORMAL ACTIVITY, found footage documents the real life exorcisms of Anneliese Michel, history's most notorious victim of demonic possession." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1911533/","name":"Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1MTk5NTE0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQyNTA5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the tradition of PARANORMAL ACTIVITY, found footage documents the real life exorcisms of Anneliese Michel, history's most notorious victim of demonic possession.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1911533/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Platypuschow","dateCreated":"2019-02-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Anneliese The Exorcist Tapes: Exploitative","reviewBody":"The Exorcist Tapes is the third movie in the very loose Paranormal Entity/Investigations franchise and is made by infamous production company The Asylum (Who I'm sure I don't need to introduce).

It tells the true story of Anneliese Michel and the case of her supposed exorcism and the two warring factions who tried to decide her fate. The doctors who wanted her to go to a hospital and seek medical treatment and the parents/priests who deemed her possessed and demanded she be subject to an exorcism.

The movie plays out as if it's real footage of the event which I find a tad exploitative and in bad taste considering the true story, what happened and the fate that Anneliese was finally dealt.

In true Paranormal Entity and Asylum tradition the movie looks ugly, has no budget behind it, has a mediocre cast and people behind the camera who must have just graduated amateur film school.

If you want to know the story of Ms.Michel then google it, maybe watch the documentary but leave this nonsense in the cold where it belongs.

The Good:

Nope

programme.title: The Eye

The Eye
programme.desc:
The Eye: Directed by David Moreau, Xavier Palud. With Jessica Alba, Alessandro Nivola, Parker Posey, Rade Serbedzija. Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0406759/","name":"The Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjczYmJhNjUtOTdmYi00MzZlLWEzOWYtNzA1ZGZjMjkwY2YyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0406759/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"applesauce91-2"},"dateCreated":"2008-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"It Could Have Been So Much More...","reviewBody":"I really wanted this movie to be good. Really. I think Jessica Alba is an extremely talented actress, and I had high hopes for this movie. J horror remake, interesting premise, Jessica Alba...sounds good so far. 

But this movie left me disappointed in when I saw it last night. The movie relies on cheap thrills that aren't frightening to the mature moviegoer. I should have expected this, as it was rated PG-13, but the theatre full of screaming 11 year olds at every jump was quite irritating. 

When it was all over, The Eye left me wanting more. The only thinking and mystery in the movie is done for you and the "science-talk" from Alba seems unrealistic. It relies on loud noises and horror movie clichés at every turn. The Eye is a definite popcorn movie. It may be entertaining for younger viewers, but if you want a deeper and more engaging story, look elsewhere.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52989,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-10-29","keywords":"corneal transplant,eye,violinist,eye transplant,seeing dead people","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Eye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi263323929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Eye Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004695/","name":"Jessica Alba"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000205/","name":"Parker Posey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219963/","name":"David Moreau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0658837/","name":"Xavier Palud"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179341/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012382/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0349406/","name":"Sebastian Gutierrez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1040327/","name":"Yuet-Jan Hui"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161152/","name":"Oxide Chun Pang"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Edge of Winter
U progu zimy
Edge of Winter
programme.desc: Edge of Winter: Directed by Rob Connolly. With Joel Kinnaman, Percy Hynes White, Tom Holland, Rachelle Lefevre. When two brothers are stranded by a brutal winter storm with an unpredictable father they barely know, the boys begin to suspect their supposed protector may be their biggest threat." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4526546/","name":"Edge of Winter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgzOTg5NDE5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTM5MTA1OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When two brothers are stranded by a brutal winter storm with an unpredictable father they barely know, the boys begin to suspect their supposed protector may be their biggest threat.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4526546/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shemarnold"},"dateCreated":"2018-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cold and bleak but ok","reviewBody":"The setup of the story for the fathers downward spiral was reasonably done and one many part time fathers will identify with. Time was taken to show the relationship between the father and sons which means the climax feels a little rushed. Acting performances are good but some parts of the plot line are baffling. Like when the cabin is burned down so they can escape. Surely a stealthy escape would have given them more time? No movie is perfect and after seeing the reviews I wasn't expecting too much but despite the faults this was time well spent and a nice change from the blockbuster movie norm.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3999,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2016-08-02","keywords":"brother brother relationship,father son relationship,teenage boy,winter,snow","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2060498713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzODM0OTMwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTQ1OTA0OTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzODM0OTMwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTQ1OTA0OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Recently divorced and laid off from his job, Elliot Baker (Joel Kinnaman, Suicide Squad; Run All Night) is desperate to spend more time bonding with his sons, Bradley (Tom Holland, Captain America: Civil War) and Caleb (Percy Hynes White, Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb). What starts as family day trip to teach his boys how to shoot turns into a nightmare when they become stranded. As they retreat to a desolate cabin, Elliot's mounting fear of losing custody pushes him to the edge. The brothers quickly realize that the man responsible for keeping them safe has now become their biggest threat."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1172478/","name":"Joel Kinnaman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4007171/","name":"Percy Hynes White"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4043618/","name":"Tom Holland"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2618128/","name":"Rob Connolly"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0232635/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0496439/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0593227/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1954504/","name":"Kyle Mann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2618128/","name":"Rob Connolly"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Children of Men
Ludzkie dzieci
Children of Men
programme.desc: Children of Men: Directed by Alfonso Cuarón. With Juan Gabriel Yacuzzi, Mishal Husain, Rob Curling, Jon Chevalier. In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have become somehow infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0206634/","name":"Children of Men","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5NTI2NTI4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjk2NDA2OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have become somehow infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0206634/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jflet"},"dateCreated":"2006-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Carefully crafted piece of work","reviewBody":"This year I attended for the first time the Venice Film Festival in Italy. I was of course quite excited and bought tickets to some screenings of a few different films I found interesting. Initially Children of Men wasn't in my plans but I was convinced by a friend who was very enthusiastic about it. Now I say I'm glad I bought the tickets! What an amazing film this is. The science fiction genre is just a coat to project into the future the horrors and problems of our current days and many films attempt that ending up, in most cases, failing. This one however succeeds. Succeeds indeed but not only in this... The film blew away nearly everyone in the audience as one of the best action movies we have seen lately, with extremely exciting and brutal chases, gun fights, etc. Don't be put off by this though, the film is as good as it is not because of the action sequences but its amazingly emotional and touching story. The performances of the cast is impressive especially Clive Owen and the newcomer Claire Hope Ashitey who throughout the film develop the relationship between their characters and it's such a joy to see the development. I'm not very good at writing reviews so I think I'll stop know, but I had at least to transmit something to everyone who might be interested in watching this film. Don't pass this one, you won't regret it. In my view one of the few excellent films released this year.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":485003,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2007-04-04","keywords":"long take,england,fertility,neo noir,british government","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"'Extraction' Action Satisfaction Watchlist","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2615787033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU3YmRlMjUtNzdkNS00Y2NhLWJlN2QtOTdiZGZjM2YzODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU3YmRlMjUtNzdkNS00Y2NhLWJlN2QtOTdiZGZjM2YzODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"On this spoiler-filled IMDbrief, we break down the globe-trotting shoot-'em-up 'Extraction' and offer up some other action flicks if your pulse is pounding for more."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654110/","name":"Clive Owen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0252230/","name":"Chiwetel Ejiofor"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190859/","name":"Alfonso Cuarón"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086710/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011026/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190859/","name":"Alfonso Cuarón"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0786694/","name":"Timothy J. programme.desc: Kulisy powstawaniu najgłośniejszych, najbardziej popularnych filmów. Widzowie poznają ich budżet oraz zobaczą, jak przebiega praca na planie. Wszystko to wydarzy się w niecałe siedem minut.

programme.title: Saint Ralph
Święty Ralph
Saint Ralph
programme.desc:
Saint Ralph: Directed by Michael McGowan. With Adam Butcher, Michael Kanevsky, Gordon Pinsent, Tamara Hope. Saint Ralph is the unlikely story of Ralph Walker, a ninth grader who outran everyone's expectations except his own in his bold quest of trying to win the 1954 Boston Marathon." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0384488/","name":"Saint Ralph","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzkzODM3NDk3M15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNDQ2NzA3._V1_.jpg","description":"Saint Ralph is the unlikely story of Ralph Walker, a ninth grader who outran everyone's expectations except his own in his bold quest of trying to win the 1954 Boston Marathon.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0384488/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jotix100"},"dateCreated":"2007-12-19","inLanguage":"English","name":"Knowing one's saints","reviewBody":"Ralph Walker, the young man at the center of this story, gets more than his share of bad situations at a tender age. Ralph, who has lost his father, sees his own mother struck by a serious illness and watches her go into a coma. Ralph's spirit is never broken and never questions his bad luck the way some other teen would. Ralph is never given to despair, or emotional outbursts when he can't do much to help the situations he is thrown into. Ultimately, Ralph is a real winner, not only because he decides to do something about his life, but because he is an optimist at heart who will never be defeated.

Michael McGowan, the Canadian creator of this enormously appealing film has gathered the right elements to make us go with him in this fantastic voyage that shows us the positive side of life. Mr. McGowan was lucky in getting Adam Kutcher to portray Ralph Walker. This young actor shows us he is a natural who under the guidance of the director, gives a tremendous performance and steals our hearts in the process.

"Saint Ralph" is one of the best things that have come out of Canada in recent years. Campbell Scott gives a good performance as Father Hibbert, the man who guides Ralph in the right direction. The excellent Gordon Pinsent, makes the perfect head master Father Fitzpatrick, a man who is never in touch with the young people he is supposed to lead and help shape their minds into being good citizens. Jennifer Tilly, Tamara Hope, Shauna MacDonald, and Michael Kaney, are also seen in key minor roles.

The film is highly recommended because it gives the viewer a positive take on life. Michael McGowan must be congratulated in giving us a movie that will be hard to forget because it feels real from beginning to end.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":6024,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Sport"],"datePublished":"2005-04-08","keywords":"doubt,male protagonist,year 1954,character name as title,nickname as title","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Saint Ralph","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1619329305","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDYwNGEzNWYtNjlhMy00ZGRmLThiYTYtZjk0YzYzMmU2YzU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDYwNGEzNWYtNjlhMy00ZGRmLThiYTYtZjk0YzYzMmU2YzU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Samuel Goldwyn"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0124666/","name":"Adam Butcher"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001714/","name":"Campbell Scott"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000236/","name":"Jennifer Tilly"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1313340/","name":"Michael McGowan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0054762/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072477/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0297908/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1313340/","name":"Michael McGowan"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

When two freshmen pledges are accepted into the biggest party frat on campus (ALPHA HOUSE), they think they have it all. That is, until the assistant dean forces the Alphas to share their house with a sorority or face expulsion from school. programme.title: Earthstorm
Desperacka misja
Earthstorm
programme.desc:
Earthstorm: Directed by Terry Cunningham. With Stephen Baldwin, Amy Price-Francis, John Ralston, Dirk Benedict. A massive asteroid impact on the moon begins causing storms on Earth due to the sudden changes in ocean tides. Scientists conclude the only solution is to set nuclear charges on the Moon to implode it and keep it whole." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0491764/","name":"Earthstorm","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDc3OWY2OWYtMmJkYy00MmJkLTk0M2UtNDYyNDAyN2U5NmI4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTY5Nzc4MDY@._V1_.jpg","description":"A massive asteroid impact on the moon begins causing storms on Earth due to the sudden changes in ocean tides. Scientists conclude the only solution is to set nuclear charges on the Moon to implode it and keep it whole.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0491764/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kevinlangille"},"dateCreated":"2006-12-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Armagedon in the style of Ed Wood.","reviewBody":"This is what I get for being bored on a Monday night. I mean how bad can it be, Steve Baldwin, Dirk Benedict (Starbuck, where ya been). I at least hope they were able to pay their rent for the month after this.

As the title of this review states the movie is basically Armagedon but instead of an asteroid we are in peril due to the moon and a fault line which has opened up on its surface. The Ed Wood reference is because everything else in the film makes me think that if Ed was still alive and had even the slightest budget this is what he would be making. The shuttle set kept making me remember the plane cockpit from Plan 9, except no curtain for a door this time. All of the effects have a Nintendo 64 look to them (even a PS2 would be better) or a rip from a Discovery channel special on space travel.

Of the acting I can't really complain, nothing great but nothing overly bad. I was excited at the beginning to see Dirk Benedict acting again but he seems to just come in and out of the film.

In the end I think I laughed more then anything, not something to get worked up about for sure.

Also, not to my country's credit, this is a Canadian film not an American one as the IMDb site states. At the end of the credits it clearly states that it is a Ontario-Quebec co-production (so sad).","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1969,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Action","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"keywords":"disaster movie,disaster film,moon,demolition,demolitions expert","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Earthstorm","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1654915353","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjA5NWY0NDUtYzNiNy00MmFiLWFmZTUtNjFiMWQwMDhmZTlmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjA5NWY0NDUtYzNiNy00MmFiLWFmZTUtNjFiMWQwMDhmZTlmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from First Look"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000286/","name":"Stephen Baldwin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0697201/","name":"Amy Price-Francis"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0707816/","name":"John Ralston"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0192463/","name":"Terry Cunningham"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017447/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0453070/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0307658/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0465480/","name":"Michael Konyves"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes
Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes
programme.desc:
Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes: Directed by Jude Gerard Prest. With Yaz Canli, Kai Cofer, Christopher Karl Johnson, Nikki Muller. In the tradition of PARANORMAL ACTIVITY, found footage documents the real life exorcisms of Anneliese Michel, history's most notorious victim of demonic possession." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1911533/","name":"Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1MTk5NTE0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQyNTA5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the tradition of PARANORMAL ACTIVITY, found footage documents the real life exorcisms of Anneliese Michel, history's most notorious victim of demonic possession.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1911533/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Platypuschow"},"dateCreated":"2019-02-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Anneliese The Exorcist Tapes: Exploitative","reviewBody":"The Exorcist Tapes is the third movie in the very loose Paranormal Entity/Investigations franchise and is made by infamous production company The Asylum (Who I'm sure I don't need to introduce).

It tells the true story of Anneliese Michel and the case of her supposed exorcism and the two warring factions who tried to decide her fate. The doctors who wanted her to go to a hospital and seek medical treatment and the parents/priests who deemed her possessed and demanded she be subject to an exorcism.

The movie plays out as if it's real footage of the event which I find a tad exploitative and in bad taste considering the true story, what happened and the fate that Anneliese was finally dealt.

In true Paranormal Entity and Asylum tradition the movie looks ugly, has no budget behind it, has a mediocre cast and people behind the camera who must have just graduated amateur film school.

If you want to know the story of Ms.Michel then google it, maybe watch the documentary but leave this nonsense in the cold where it belongs.

The Good:

Nope

The Bad:

Rather bad taste pretending it's real footage based on what actually happened

In the tradition of PARANORMAL ACTIVITY, found footage documents the real life exorcisms of Anneliese Michel, history's most notorious victim of demonic possession." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1911533/","name":"Anneliese: The Exorcist Tapes","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjE1MTk5NTE0N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjQyNTA5Ng@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In the tradition of PARANORMAL ACTIVITY, found footage documents the real life exorcisms of Anneliese Michel, history's most notorious victim of demonic possession.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1911533/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"Platypuschow","dateCreated":"2019-02-20","inLanguage":"English","name":"Anneliese The Exorcist Tapes: Exploitative","reviewBody":"The Exorcist Tapes is the third movie in the very loose Paranormal Entity/Investigations franchise and is made by infamous production company The Asylum (Who I'm sure I don't need to introduce).

It tells the true story of Anneliese Michel and the case of her supposed exorcism and the two warring factions who tried to decide her fate. The doctors who wanted her to go to a hospital and seek medical treatment and the parents/priests who deemed her possessed and demanded she be subject to an exorcism.

The movie plays out as if it's real footage of the event which I find a tad exploitative and in bad taste considering the true story, what happened and the fate that Anneliese was finally dealt.

In true Paranormal Entity and Asylum tradition the movie looks ugly, has no budget behind it, has a mediocre cast and people behind the camera who must have just graduated amateur film school.

If you want to know the story of Ms.Michel then google it, maybe watch the documentary but leave this nonsense in the cold where it belongs.

The Good:

Nope

The Bad:

Rather bad taste pretending it's real footage based on what actually happened

programme.title: Edge of Winter
U progu zimy
Edge of Winter
programme.desc: Edge of Winter: Directed by Rob Connolly. With Joel Kinnaman, Percy Hynes White, Tom Holland, Rachelle Lefevre. When two brothers are stranded by a brutal winter storm with an unpredictable father they barely know, the boys begin to suspect their supposed protector may be their biggest threat." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt4526546/","name":"Edge of Winter","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgzOTg5NDE5MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwOTM5MTA1OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"When two brothers are stranded by a brutal winter storm with an unpredictable father they barely know, the boys begin to suspect their supposed protector may be their biggest threat.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt4526546/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shemarnold"},"dateCreated":"2018-07-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cold and bleak but ok","reviewBody":"The setup of the story for the fathers downward spiral was reasonably done and one many part time fathers will identify with. Time was taken to show the relationship between the father and sons which means the climax feels a little rushed. Acting performances are good but some parts of the plot line are baffling. Like when the cabin is burned down so they can escape. Surely a stealthy escape would have given them more time? No movie is perfect and after seeing the reviews I wasn't expecting too much but despite the faults this was time well spent and a nice change from the blockbuster movie norm.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3999,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Drama","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2016-08-02","keywords":"brother brother relationship,father son relationship,teenage boy,winter,snow","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2060498713","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzODM0OTMwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTQ1OTA0OTE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTYzODM0OTMwN15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNTQ1OTA0OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Recently divorced and laid off from his job, Elliot Baker (Joel Kinnaman, Suicide Squad; Run All Night) is desperate to spend more time bonding with his sons, Bradley (Tom Holland, Captain America: Civil War) and Caleb (Percy Hynes White, Night at the Museum: Secret of the Tomb). What starts as family day trip to teach his boys how to shoot turns into a nightmare when they become stranded. As they retreat to a desolate cabin, Elliot's mounting fear of losing custody pushes him to the edge. The brothers quickly realize that the man responsible for keeping them safe has now become their biggest threat."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1172478/","name":"Joel Kinnaman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4007171/","name":"Percy Hynes White"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4043618/","name":"Tom Holland"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2618128/","name":"Rob Connolly"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0232635/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0496439/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0593227/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1954504/","name":"Kyle Mann"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2618128/","name":"Rob Connolly"}],"duration":"PT1H29M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: The Eye
Oko
The Eye
programme.desc:
The Eye: Directed by David Moreau, Xavier Palud. With Jessica Alba, Alessandro Nivola, Parker Posey, Rade Serbedzija. Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0406759/","name":"The Eye","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjczYmJhNjUtOTdmYi00MzZlLWEzOWYtNzA1ZGZjMjkwY2YyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTIzOTk5ODM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Violinist Sydney Wells was accidentally blinded by her sister Helen when she was five years old. She submits to a cornea transplantation, and while recovering from the operation, she realizes that she is seeing dead people.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0406759/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"applesauce91-2"},"dateCreated":"2008-02-02","inLanguage":"English","name":"It Could Have Been So Much More...","reviewBody":"I really wanted this movie to be good. Really. I think Jessica Alba is an extremely talented actress, and I had high hopes for this movie. J horror remake, interesting premise, Jessica Alba...sounds good so far. 

But this movie left me disappointed in when I saw it last night. The movie relies on cheap thrills that aren't frightening to the mature moviegoer. I should have expected this, as it was rated PG-13, but the theatre full of screaming 11 year olds at every jump was quite irritating. 

When it was all over, The Eye left me wanting more. The only thinking and mystery in the movie is done for you and the "science-talk" from Alba seems unrealistic. It relies on loud noises and horror movie clichés at every turn. The Eye is a definite popcorn movie. It may be entertaining for younger viewers, but if you want a deeper and more engaging story, look elsewhere.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":3}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":52989,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Horror","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2008-10-29","keywords":"corneal transplant,eye,violinist,eye transplant,seeing dead people","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"The Eye","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi263323929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjM1MzAyNzkxM15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzA4ODYzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"The Eye Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004695/","name":"Jessica Alba"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005273/","name":"Alessandro Nivola"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000205/","name":"Parker Posey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1219963/","name":"David Moreau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0658837/","name":"Xavier Palud"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0173285/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0179341/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0012382/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0349406/","name":"Sebastian Gutierrez"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1040327/","name":"Yuet-Jan Hui"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0161152/","name":"Oxide Chun Pang"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Children of Men
Ludzkie dzieci
Children of Men
programme.desc: Children of Men: Directed by Alfonso Cuarón. With Juan Gabriel Yacuzzi, Mishal Husain, Rob Curling, Jon Chevalier. In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have become somehow infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0206634/","name":"Children of Men","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5NTI2NTI4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjk2NDA2OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have become somehow infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0206634/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jflet"},"dateCreated":"2006-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Carefully crafted piece of work","reviewBody":"This year I attended for the first time the Venice Film Festival in Italy. I was of course quite excited and bought tickets to some screenings of a few different films I found interesting. Initially Children of Men wasn't in my plans but I was convinced by a friend who was very enthusiastic about it. Now I say I'm glad I bought the tickets! What an amazing film this is. The science fiction genre is just a coat to project into the future the horrors and problems of our current days and many films attempt that ending up, in most cases, failing. This one however succeeds. Succeeds indeed but not only in this... The film blew away nearly everyone in the audience as one of the best action movies we have seen lately, with extremely exciting and brutal chases, gun fights, etc. Don't be put off by this though, the film is as good as it is not because of the action sequences but its amazingly emotional and touching story. The performances of the cast is impressive especially Clive Owen and the newcomer Claire Hope Ashitey who throughout the film develop the relationship between their characters and it's such a joy to see the development. I'm not very good at writing reviews so I think I'll stop know, but I had at least to transmit something to everyone who might be interested in watching this film. Don't pass this one, you won't regret it. In my view one of the few excellent films released this year.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":485003,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2007-04-04","keywords":"long take,england,fertility,neo noir,british government","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"'Extraction' Action Satisfaction Watchlist","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2615787033","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU3YmRlMjUtNzdkNS00Y2NhLWJlN2QtOTdiZGZjM2YzODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU3YmRlMjUtNzdkNS00Y2NhLWJlN2QtOTdiZGZjM2YzODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"On this spoiler-filled IMDbrief, we break down the globe-trotting shoot-'em-up 'Extraction' and offer up some other action flicks if your pulse is pounding for more."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654110/","name":"Clive Owen"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0252230/","name":"Chiwetel Ejiofor"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190859/","name":"Alfonso Cuarón"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086710/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011026/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190859/","name":"Alfonso Cuarón"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0786694/","name":"Timothy J. In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have become somehow infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0206634/","name":"Children of Men","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTQ5NTI2NTI4NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjk2NDA2OQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"In 2027, in a chaotic world in which women have become somehow infertile, a former activist agrees to help transport a miraculously pregnant woman to a sanctuary at sea.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0206634/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"jflet","dateCreated":"2006-09-12","inLanguage":"English","name":"Carefully crafted piece of work","reviewBody":"This year I attended for the first time the Venice Film Festival in Italy. I was of course quite excited and bought tickets to some screenings of a few different films I found interesting. Initially Children of Men wasn't in my plans but I was convinced by a friend who was very enthusiastic about it. Now I say I'm glad I bought the tickets! What an amazing film this is. The science fiction genre is just a coat to project into the future the horrors and problems of our current days and many films attempt that ending up, in most cases, failing. This one however succeeds. Succeeds indeed but not only in this... The film blew away nearly everyone in the audience as one of the best action movies we have seen lately, with extremely exciting and brutal chases, gun fights, etc. Don't be put off by this though, the film is as good as it is not because of the action sequences but its amazingly emotional and touching story. The performances of the cast is impressive especially Clive Owen and the newcomer Claire Hope Ashitey who throughout the film develop the relationship between their characters and it's such a joy to see the development. I'm not very good at writing reviews so I think I'll stop know, but I had at least to transmit something to everyone who might be interested in watching this film. Don't pass this one, you won't regret it. In my view one of the few excellent films released this year.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":9,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":485003,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.9,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2007-04-04","keywords":"long take,england,fertility,neo noir,british government","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"'Extraction' Action Satisfaction Watchlist","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2615787033","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU3YmRlMjUtNzdkNS00Y2NhLWJlN2QtOTdiZGZjM2YzODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODU3YmRlMjUtNzdkNS00Y2NhLWJlN2QtOTdiZGZjM2YzODUxXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"On this spoiler-filled IMDbrief, we break down the globe-trotting shoot-'em-up 'Extraction' and offer up some other action flicks if your pulse is pounding for more.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000194/","name":"Julianne Moore","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0654110/","name":"Clive Owen","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0252230/","name":"Chiwetel Ejiofor"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190859/","name":"Alfonso Cuarón"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005073/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0086710/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0011026/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0190859/","name":"Alfonso Cuarón","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0786694/","name":"Timothy J. Blue Streak
programme.desc: Blue Streak: Directed by Les Mayfield. With Martin Lawrence, Luke Wilson, Peter Greene, Dave Chappelle. A former convict poses as a cop to retrieve a diamond he stole years ago." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0181316/","name":"Blue Streak","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTJkYTBlZjktYmYyYi00ZWQ0LTgyMWYtMjQ5Yzg1Y2M3YzE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQxNzMzNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"A former convict poses as a cop to retrieve a diamond he stole years ago.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0181316/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"BJ-54"},"dateCreated":"2000-05-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Very funny","reviewBody":"This movie was about Martin Lawrence being double crossed during a jewel hyst. In the process of fighting off his co-conspirators, he is arrested and jailed for 2 years. He finds out that the warehouse, where the jewel is hidden, is now a police station. Lawrence gets a fake i.d. and becomes a police officer. Lawrence is a good police officer because 1) he is a crook at heart and 2) many of the crooks in town are his friends.\n\nAnyway, the movie gives you laugh after laugh of Martin outsmarting crooks trying to get on with the business of getting this jewel he previously stole. He eventually gets the jewel. A very funny movie."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":80688,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.3},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1999-09-17","keywords":"fbi federal bureau of investigation,buddy comedy,cigarette,impostor,impersonator","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Blue Streak","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1012900889","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkYmQyNTYtMmY4YS00NjljLWFiZGYtNjM4ZTI2MzgzMzdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzNkYmQyNTYtMmY4YS00NjljLWFiZGYtNjM4ZTI2MzgzMzdiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer for Blue Streak"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001454/","name":"Martin Lawrence"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005561/","name":"Luke Wilson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0338886/","name":"Peter Greene"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0562645/","name":"Les Mayfield"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0149490/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0059088/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1158243/","name":"Michael Berry"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0089824/","name":"John Blumenthal"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0139461/","name":"Stephen Carpenter"}],"duration":"PT1H33M"}</script><metacontent="

Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt0364845/","name":"NCIS: Naval Criminal Investigative Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjVlMjZhYzYtOGQxNC00OTQxLTk2NzEtMWFmMmNhODA4YjYzXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjQ3MDgwNjY@._V1_.jpg","description":"The cases of the Naval Criminal Investigative Service's Washington, D.C. Major Case Response Team, led by Special Agent Leroy Jethro Gibbs.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0364845/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"shellemk"},"dateCreated":"2004-09-23","inLanguage":"English","name":"Time flies when you're enjoying yourself","reviewBody":"and each episode speeds along all too quickly! I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! What more could you ask for in a show?! There's not a single character I'd change  none that irritate  they're all excellent. I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. Only problem is that living in England, who knows how long after it's shown in the US we'll get to see it! Fortunately it's worth the wait!"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":134442,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"TV-14","genre":["Action","Crime","Drama"],"datePublished":"2003-09-23","keywords":"goth girl,babe scientist,special agent,naval criminal investigative service,police procedural","actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001319/","name":"Mark Harmon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0564724/","name":"David McCallum"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0615266/","name":"Sean Murray"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0114905/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0066107/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0183875/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0069074/","name":"Donald P. I LOVE this show ! What is there NOT to like? Rich story lines, strongly portrayed (and very human) personalities you can really warm to who play off each other brilliantly, all with their own distinctive quirks and  above all  the always wonderful Mark Harmon as main character! I consider it a bonus that it's the one thing on TV that all our family equally enjoy for different reasons. Even my father-in-law likes this and we normally have totally different viewing preferences! I was delighted when I heard that there was a second series imminent. programme.title: Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
Candice Renoir
programme.desc: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. programme.review: IMDb data; ttnr: 2819924, Title: Candice Renoir, --- Description: Candice Renoir: Created by Robin Barataud, Brigitte Peskine, Solen Roy-Pagenault. With Cécile Bois, Raphaël Lenglet, Clara Antoons, Ali Marhyar. The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. Candice herself is a mother of 4 children and recently divorced. Her daily routine is between solving crimes, taking out fights with her much younger female police superior officer, getting her kids to school - in addition - handling their problems too and keeping her team in line. It's a very funny and witty series with a lot of french charm and intelligent story writing. Not another dull crime series all over again. It's like a fresh french breeze on the TV screen. Candice is like a female Columbo version in high heels, handbag pink scarf and a 9mm in her holster." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"TVSeries","url":"/title/tt2819924/","name":"Candice Renoir","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWM3YzUxM2UtZjIyMC00Zjg5LTk0NTMtNGQ3ZWQ0ODhlMTJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNjc0NTExNDI@._V1_.jpg","description":"The story circles around French police officer Commandant Candice Renoir and her team solving different crime cases in a harbor city of south France. programme.title: Peter Rabbit
Piotruś Królik
Peter Rabbit
programme.desc: Peter Rabbit: Directed by Will Gluck. With James Corden, Fayssal Bazzi, Domhnall Gleeson, Sia. Feature adaptation of Beatrix Potter's classic tale of a rebellious rabbit trying to sneak into a farmer's vegetable garden." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt5117670/","name":"Peter Rabbit","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzI5MzZmZjItOGQzZC00NjNiLWFjMjQtMGNhY2NmNDMyNGM1XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTMxODk2OTU@._V1_.jpg","description":"Feature adaptation of Beatrix Potter's classic tale of a rebellious rabbit trying to sneak into a farmer's vegetable garden.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt5117670/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"alvaro-a-quesada-558-141800"},"dateCreated":"2018-03-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"THIS FILM STICKS TO YOUR HEART-GET EXTRA NAPKINS AT THE CONCESSION.","reviewBody":"BRA-VO. This is a BRILLIANT film, very sweet and heartfelt. Not sure why there has been so many bad reviews and a lot of self-righteous comments--but they need to check their politics at the door, and for goodness sake--just have fun, people. Can't we just enjoy it? Why does it have to be so complicated? I can think of a million other things that are much worse--than this Peter Rabbit film, which by the way, there is nothing wrong with Peter Rabbit 3.0. Go see it. You're going to love it, as much as I would've felt the original author would have too, as this is based on her tale for kids, but it is technically a sequel--as you will understand when you see it. First off, they are rabbits, and rabbits are mischievous by nature, when they are bored or there is food at stake. They are also a bit affectionately demanding and territorial as they felt with Bea. Within the context of the film, rabbits don't understand what the implications of allergic reactions could be for humans--they are, yes, rabbits. The humor is just hilarious, and it works well coming from farm animals. This is CGI/A vs. real live humans. It kept me engaged throughout. I saw this one with my daughter and we both laughed so much and so hard -- isn't this what it is all about? a positive experience? One that brings you closer with those you are with? I cried, I laughed, I cried so hard I laughed, and laughed so hard I cried -- and this is how I rate/gauge film I watch -- by how it moves me and the positivity it inspires in me; it felt good to be reminded that I was still human. I just loved, loved, loved this film. I recommend it. This one will definitely make it into my collection once it is released in media format -- and not many make it in. The soundtrack is super amazing too--I can't stress that enough. They hit it on the head with this one. A TRUE STORY OF HUMBLENESS AND REDEMPTION. Your heart will melt into a big puddle--hands down. No one is paying me to write this--I give it 10 Gold stars. I want to see Peter win next year at the Oscars. A TOTAL GEM.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":40669,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG","genre":["Animation","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2018-02-09","keywords":"rabbit,deer,mouse,fox,pig","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2445195289","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc0YWQ5MzctNjM2ZS00YWNhLWFiYjktZjM3NzMxMmQwOGZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzc0YWQ5MzctNjM2ZS00YWNhLWFiYjktZjM3NzMxMmQwOGZkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Peter's feud with Mr. McGregor escalates to greater heights than ever before as they rival for the affections of the warm-hearted animal lover who lives next door."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0179479/","name":"James Corden"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2417960/","name":"Fayssal Bazzi"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1727304/","name":"Domhnall Gleeson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0323239/","name":"Will Gluck"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0605949/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005154/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1464577/","name":"Rob Lieber"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0323239/","name":"Will Gluck"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0693229/","name":"Beatrix Potter"}],"duration":"PT1H35M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Viddana
Zniewolona: Felix Austria
Viddana
programme.desc: Viddana: Directed by Christina Sivolap. With Marianna Januszewicz, Alesya Romanova, Roman Lutskyi, Sebastian Cybulski. Welcome to the kitchen of the perfect maid Stefania Chornenko where she excels in cooking while intoxicating the marriage of her half-sister master Adelia Anger against the backdrop of 1900 small town on the outskirts of Austro-Hungary." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt11402054/","name":"Viddana","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYmU5NDJjMDItNmFmNi00ZTNhLTk5NjktMGRjYzRhYTM3Yjg2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTg4ODkzODA@._V1_.jpg","description":"Welcome to the kitchen of the perfect maid Stefania Chornenko where she excels in cooking while intoxicating the marriage of her half-sister master Adelia Anger against the backdrop of 1900 small town on the outskirts of Austro-Hunga","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt11402054/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"cherry_town"},"dateCreated":"2020-05-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"An expensive costume drama","reviewBody":"A costly costume drama which cost a fortune to Ukrainian taxpayers (state support for the cinematography which compensates for a half of production budget) but vanishes in the distant fringes of memory. Though the author of the novel upon which the movie is based on is one of the scriptwriters, the piece is the pale semblance of her pretty decent story. Characters are shallow. With all respect for the Polish actress who performs Stephanie, it remains an enigma for me why a casting director could not find a Ukrainian for this role. Scene backgrounds seem to be plastered on a canvass; at least the crew told stories they could not find proper locations because all Ukrainian cities in the West are tarred with plastic window frames which could not be found in Austrian-Hungarian empire. The only solace is that it takes time and quantity to hone skills in domestic cinema production. This movie is just a humus for future Ukrainian blockbasters.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":446,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.7},"genre":["Drama","Fantasy","History"],"datePublished":"2020-01-16","keywords":"marriage,timeframe 1900s","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Viddana","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3563437593","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDY4YzEwMGMtN2YwYi00NzIyLTkwM2MtOTNjMmRmNDQ5MmY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDY4YzEwMGMtN2YwYi00NzIyLTkwM2MtOTNjMmRmNDQ5MmY4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Viddana"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4572530/","name":"Marianna Januszewicz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9574320/","name":"Alesya Romanova"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5926117/","name":"Roman Lutskyi"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm7149281/","name":"Christina Sivolap"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0428598/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0352409/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm11184895/","name":"Sofia Andrukhovych"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3972206/","name":"Alina Semeryakova"}],"duration":"PT1H43M"}</script><metacontent="

Though the author of the novel upon which the movie is based on is one of the scriptwriters, the piece is the pale semblance of her pretty decent story. Characters are shallow. With all respect for the Polish actress who performs Stephanie, it remains an enigma for me why a casting director could not find a Ukrainian for this role. Scene backgrounds seem to be plastered on a canvass; at least the crew told stories they could not find proper locations because all Ukrainian cities in the West are tarred with plastic window frames which could not be found in Austrian-Hungarian empire. The only solace is that it takes time and quantity to hone skills in domestic cinema production. programme.title: Hitch
Hitch: Najlepszy doradca przeciętnego faceta
Hitch
programme.desc: Hitch: Directed by Andy Tennant. With Will Smith, Eva Mendes, Kevin James, Amber Valletta. A smooth-talking man falls for a hardened columnist while helping a shy accountant woo a beautiful heiress." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0386588/","name":"Hitch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzYyNzM2NzM2NF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjg5NTQzMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A smooth-talking man falls for a hardened columnist while helping a shy accountant woo a beautiful heiress.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0386588/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"the-movie-guy"},"dateCreated":"2005-02-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cute date movie for Valentine's Day","reviewBody":"In this romantic comedy, Alex 'Hitch' Hitchins (Will Smith) is a legendary but anonymous date doctor in New York City. Hitch advises klutzy male wallflower clients on ways to make good first impressions on the women of their dreams. To contact Hitch, a man must have a referral from one of his former clients. Once Hitch accepts you as a client, he will coach you on your first three dates; after that, you're on your own. Hitch's newest client is Albert Brennaman (Kevin James), a fat tax accountant in love with a celebrity client, Allegra Cole (Amber Valetta). Allegra doesn't know that Albert exists, so Albert contacts Hitch to make his dream come true. Hitch decides to make Albert a client, even though, he knows this is going to be tough. While working on this job, Hitch meets Sara Melas (Eva Mendes), a gossip reporter for a daily tabloid, who is following Allegra's every move. Sara has given up on men, and Hitch wants to cut through that layer, because he is the master of love, so he thinks. With Valentine's Day around the corner, this is a good date movie. Women will love it, and men may pick up a few pointers. The movie is hilarious and filled with verbal and slapstick comedy from beginning to end. There are several scenes that may make you bust a gut laughing. (Columbia, Run time 1:55, Rated PG-13)(8/10)"},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":307581,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.6},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2005-03-02","keywords":"gossip,quitting a job,newspaper,friendship,advice","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hitch","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi811574297","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlhZTM4MjQtMzEyNC00ODg4LWIxYzYtMmRmMjc3NGQ5MTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZDlhZTM4MjQtMzEyNC00ODg4LWIxYzYtMmRmMjc3NGQ5MTYyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 2 for Hitch"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0578949/","name":"Eva Mendes"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0416673/","name":"Kevin James"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0855035/","name":"Andy Tennant"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0072775/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1358355/","name":"Kevin Bisch"}],"duration":"PT1H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Pamięć absolutna
Total Recall
programme.desc: Niedaleka przyszłość. Po licznych wojnach warunki życia na Ziemi znacznie się pogorszyły. Ludzie zamieszkują jedynie Zjednoczoną Federację Brytanii i Kolonię. Żądny wrażeń robotnik Douglas Quaid (Colin Farrell) poddaje się procedurze wszczepienia wspomnień. Niestety, nie wszystko idzie zgodnie z planem. W efekcie Quaid staje się poszukiwanym renegatem. By się ratować, dołącza do ruchu oporu, którym kieruje charyzmatyczny Matthias (Bill Nighy). Próbuje odzyskać swą prawdziwą tożsamość.

programme.title: Hancock
Hancock
programme.desc: Hancock: Directed by Peter Berg. With Will Smith, Charlize Theron, Jason Bateman, Jae Head. Hancock is a superhero whose ill-considered behavior regularly causes damage in the millions. He changes when the person he saves helps him improve his public image." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0448157/","name":"Hancock","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyMzc4ODU3NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjk5Mzc1MQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Hancock is a superhero whose ill-considered behavior regularly causes damage in the millions. He changes when the person he saves helps him improve his public image.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0448157/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kathleen-pangan"},"dateCreated":"2008-07-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"About a superhuman who is just very human","reviewBody":"Hancock was a pretty interesting as well as entertaining movie. It definitely wasn't your typical superhero movie; and it wasn't originally a DC or Marvel comic. It's more about what would happen if someone with superheroes was around in modern times, and that is what makes it interesting. If there's some property damage done while catching criminals, people will be angry; if a vigilante has a bad attitude, people will be angry. I suppose Batman explores some of that not being liked by the public, as well as the bad attitude and personal trauma of the hero, but I found Hancock to be quite original in its handling of these issues. I liked the media attention and the use of sunglasses as a "mask" of sorts. I really liked how Hancock progresses as a character, and I liked the other characters as well. Usually little kids in movies annoy me, but the son of the supporting character was pretty cute and endearing. This isn't really a hero movie where there is a superhero and a super villain; I think it's more about what it means to be a human and relate to other people, to do good things and the desire to be accepted. I think the best part of Hancock is that it's about a superhuman who is just very human. It was a lot of fun.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":464352,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2008-07-02","keywords":"superhero,black superhero,non comic book superhero,tough girl,destruction","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hancock: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2497904921","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MjY1MjU1MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk2NzMzMzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MjY1MjU1MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk2NzMzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the second theatrical trailer for Hancock, directed by Peter Berg."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000234/","name":"Charlize Theron"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000867/","name":"Jason Bateman"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000916/","name":"Peter Berg"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0237209/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1378206/","name":"Vy Vincent Ngo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0319213/","name":"Vince Gilligan"}],"duration":"PT1H32M"}</script><metacontent="

I suppose Batman explores some of that not being liked by the public, as well as the bad attitude and personal trauma of the hero, but I found Hancock to be quite original in its handling of these issues. I liked the media attention and the use of sunglasses as a "mask" of sorts. I really liked how Hancock progresses as a character, and I liked the other characters as well. Usually little kids in movies annoy me, but the son of the supporting character was pretty cute and endearing. This isn't really a hero movie where there is a superhero and a super villain; I think it's more about what it means to be a human and relate to other people, to do good things and the desire to be accepted. I think the best part of Hancock is that it's about a superhuman who is just very human. It was a lot of fun.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":464352,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.4,"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Drama","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2008-07-02","keywords":"superhero,black superhero,non comic book superhero,tough girl,destruction","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Hancock: Trailer #2","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2497904921","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MjY1MjU1MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk2NzMzMzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTg3MjY1MjU1MF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNjk2NzMzMzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"This is the second theatrical trailer for Hancock, directed by Peter Berg.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000234/","name":"Charlize Theron","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000867/","name":"Jason Bateman"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000916/","name":"Peter Berg"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0142678/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0237209/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1378206/","name":"Vy Vincent Ngo","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0319213/","name":"Vince Gilligan"],"duration":"PT1H32M"</script><metacontent="

https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTgyMzc4ODU3NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNjk5Mzc1MQ@@._V1_QL75_UX190_CR0,0,190,281_.jpg

programme.title: Bad Boys
Bad Boys
programme.desc:
Bad Boys: Directed by Michael Bay. With Lisa Boyle, Michael Taliferro, Emmanuel Xuereb, Tchéky Karyo. Two hip detectives protect a witness to a murder while investigating a case of stolen heroin from the evidence storage room from their police precinct." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0112442/","name":"Bad Boys","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMGE1ZTQ0ZTEtZTEwZS00NWE0LTlmMDUtMTE1ZWJiZTYzZTQ2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNTAyODkwOQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Two hip detectives protect a witness to a murder while investigating a case of stolen heroin from the evidence storage room from their police precinct.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0112442/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Casa2000"},"dateCreated":"1999-02-24","inLanguage":"English","name":"Michael Bay: The Next Big Thing","reviewBody":"I had no high hopes when I walked into this film. I like Will Smith, I like Martin Lawrence, so I figured this film will at least be funny. And it was funny, and then some. It was action packed, thrilling and a helluva good time. I came out of the theatre thinking that the guy who directed that movie is going to be huge.

Michael Bay, former music video and commercial director, has made an incredible directorial debut. The film never stops. When it isn't action-packed, it is funny. It is sexy, fun and always moving. Christian Wagner's editing is phenomenal. I love action movies that really try to be action movies. A lot of action films know that they are action films so they try to incorporate other genres to make the film more complete, but they often fail miserably. They try so hard to be something they are not that they forget what they are in the first place. The essence of the action film is the action. It is a necessary component, it needs to be there otherwise it loses its edge. "Bad Boys" doesn't just throw in the occassional action sequence to meet the expectations of the genre, but instead uses the action to help tell the story. It is this use of filmmaking that allows an action film to remain an action film and still go beyond.

Watch "Bad Boys" again and every time there is an action sequence, ask yourself why that was there and what did it accomplish. You will find that each sequence took the film to another level; it introduced an new conflict, it increased the present conflict, it eliminated a key character, it introduced a new character, and so on. There are a lot of action films out there that sacrifice story for spectacle, and the audience notices this. At the centre of all films lies the story and if it comes to a halt so does the interest of the viewers.

"Bad Boys" of course isn't the greatest story on film, or even in the action genre, but what is so appealing and memorable about "Bad Boys" is that it is just as entertaining with its story as it is with its action by combining the two without sacrificing either. Michael Bay understands the importance of the story within the structure of the film. He tells a visual story, entertaining and complete, and leaves you very satisfied. Watch for Michael Bay because he is here to stay."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":253739,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"1995-04-07","keywords":"miami florida,buddy movie,criminal investigation,murder investigation,usa","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Bad Boys","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2344091929","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjExNzlmNDgtYTI4NC00OTg3LTk3MTgtZTI4YzkxNjY1NDczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjExNzlmNDgtYTI4NC00OTg3LTk3MTgtZTI4YzkxNjY1NDczXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from Columbia Pictures"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000226/","name":"Will Smith"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001454/","name":"Martin Lawrence"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0102288/","name":"Lisa Boyle"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000881/","name":"Michael Bay"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0102770/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0303032/","name":"George Gallo"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0057398/","name":"Michael Barrie"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0611848/","name":"Jim Mulholland"}],"duration":"PT1H59M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Snatch
Przekręt
Snatch.
programme.desc:
Snatch: Directed by Guy Ritchie. With Ade, William Beck, Andy Beckwith, Ewen Bremner. Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0208092/","name":"Snatch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTA2NDYxOGYtYjU1Mi00Y2QzLTgxMTQtMWI1MGI0ZGQ5MmU4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNDk3NzU2MTQ@._V1_.jpg","description":"Unscrupulous boxing promoters, violent bookmakers, a Russian gangster, incompetent amateur robbers and supposedly Jewish jewelers fight to track down a priceless stolen diamond.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0208092/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Shiva-11"},"dateCreated":"2001-01-14","inLanguage":"English","name":"Lock, Stock, and Many Smoking Barrels","reviewBody":"The release of Tarantino's "Pulp Fiction" in 1994 prompted a schism in the staid gangster movie genre: the standard hallmarks - serious characters, gunfights, intrigue and damsels in distress - were enhanced with snappy dialogue, and gallows humour. The biggest change however was the introduction of the mobius strip-style plot line, where the concept of time is no longer linear, instead constantly folding in upon itself, flitting between past, present and future that forces the viewer to pay close attention lest they miss some subtle detail. Inevitably, numerous copycat films emerged that tried to capitalize on Tarantino's success, but it wasn't until 1998 when Guy Ritchie, an unknown British director, took on the challenge that a successor was found. Now Ritchie is determined to prove that his first time out wasn't a fluke.

Turkish is a young man with an entrepreneurial bent, who, when he's not running his gambling operation, manages bareknuckle boxers. Through a business deal gone wrong, he becomes acquainted with one Mickey O'Neil, a mumbling manic motor-mouthed piker who also happens to be a one-punch marvel. Turkish persuades Mickey to join his stable of fighters, but soon discovers that Mickey has his own agenda, and gets Turkish in trouble with the gangsters who run the underground boxing circuit. Other characters that become involved in the drama include a four-fingered degenerate gambler/jewel thief, a vicious boxing promoter, a gang of inept robbers, a polite hitman, a crazed Russian gun runner, a group of Irish gypsies, a crooked New York jeweler and a pugnacious pet. The common thread binding them all is a perfect diamond the size of a peach pit. If you aren't confused yet, you soon will be.

"Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels", Mr. Madonna's (Ritchie) first film, was shot on a small budget, with a no-name cast (except for football bad boy Vinnie Jones) and quickly became a rousing success at home and found receptive audiences abroad. While not a technically a sequel "Snatch" is stylistically very similar to "Lock, Stock ": Ritchie utilizes his trademark bombastic staccato sequences, and repeatedly bounces off on radical tangents to throw the viewer off balance. He did however opt for a decidedly darker satirical tone in this film, that may make some people uncomfortable (think "Very Bad Things"). What struck me as particularly daring was his decision to create a story with such a voluminous cast.

 Ritchie faced a daunting task with this film: how, with roughly twenty principal characters, does one adequately flesh out each character, and not hopelessly confuse the audience? The feat was made doubly difficult, as several cast members are big name stars. Somehow Ritchie manages - each actor is full bodied, receives ample screen time, and no one character is the centerpiece. With so many talented actors, it is difficult to pick out one performance that stands out: Rade Serbedzija is hilarious as the mad Russian who blithely burns through each of his nine lives, as is Vinnie Jones' manic gentleman hitman. On the other end of the spectrum, is Alan Ford as Brick Top, the promoter with a penchant for pigs, who epitomizes cold-blooded viciousness. If forced to pick my favorite however, I would have to go with Brad Pitt

Pitt resurrects his trailer trash look from "Kalifornia" and adopts a nearly indecipherable brogue that sounds like my best friend's Uncle Wally on a bad day. As Mickey O'Neil, the hard drinking wily grifter and part-time pugilist, Pitt displays a wide range of emotions, demonstrating again that he is not only a star, but also a gifted character actor. And I would be remiss if I didn't mention the dog that subtly stole every scene he appeared in.

While "Snatch" initially struggles to find its stride, and is very similar to Ritchie's earlier film, it is fresh and funny enough to make you forget any minor shortfalls and stand on its own.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":820877,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.2},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Crime"],"datePublished":"2000-09-01","keywords":"diamond,boxer,narrated by character,fight,boxing","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Snatch","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1558577433","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGU4YzdkNmQtMjJjMS00MDA4LTkwYWUtYjNiNDNhMDMzZDcwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOGU4YzdkNmQtMjJjMS00MDA4LTkwYWUtYjNiNDNhMDMzZDcwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Theatrical Trailer from Screen Gems"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005458/","name":"Jason Statham"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000093/","name":"Brad Pitt"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0334318/","name":"Stephen Graham"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005363/","name":"Guy Ritchie"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0050868/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000750/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005363/","name":"Guy Ritchie"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="
