programme.title: Le divorce
Rozwód po francusku
Le Divorce
programme.desc:
Le divorce: Directed by James Ivory. With Kate Hudson, Jean-Marie Lhomme, Naomi Watts, Esmée Buchet-Deàk. French vs. American social customs and behaviors are observed in a story about an American visiting her Frenchman-wed sister in Paris." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0306734/","name":"Le divorce","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTUxMjQ0MDgzOF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTYwNjM1MDY2._V1_.jpg","description":"French vs. American social customs and behaviors are observed in a story about an American visiting her Frenchman-wed sister in Paris.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0306734/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"lawprof"},"dateCreated":"2004-02-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"It Could Have Been Good","reviewBody":""Le Divorce" fails. Despite the beauty of the locales and the talent of the lead actors, the director couldn't decide if this is a Parisian comedy or an adult tale of marital discord gone horrifically askew.

The interaction between the two female leads is good-half-sisters and true soulmates. But their romantic and marital complications come too fast with too little depth and the film is on a train wreck in the making.

And suave, affluent, cheating Frenchmen are a stale staple of these movies. Nothing new or interesting here.

Too bad.

4/10.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":11372,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.9},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2003-08-29","keywords":"cartoon on tv,american,french,love,sex","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Le Divorce","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1636958489","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODIxZDhmOTUtZDE5OS00M2RlLWJkM2ItYjQxMjE2YWE0MjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODIxZDhmOTUtZDE5OS00M2RlLWJkM2ItYjQxMjE2YWE0MjE5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Pre"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005028/","name":"Kate Hudson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0915208/","name":"Naomi Watts"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000330/","name":"Stockard Channing"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0412465/","name":"James Ivory"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0055367/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0023815/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0424956/","name":"Diane Johnson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0695609/","name":"Ruth Prawer Jhabvala"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0412465/","name":"James Ivory"}],"duration":"PT1H57M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Jestem Andrzejem
programme.desc: Marek, introwertyczny informatyk po trzydziestce, próbuje odnaleźć się w szalonym świecie swojej młodszej dziewczyny Julki. W wyniku kłótni para się rozstaje. Marek samotnie wraca do domu, przechodząc przez ulicę zostaje śmiertelnie potrącony przez samochód. W ten sposób trafia do zaświatów. Dzięki pomocy tajemniczego chłopaka udaje mu się wrócić do żywych.

programme.title: Fever Pitch
Miłosna zagrywka
Fever Pitch
programme.desc:
Fever Pitch: Directed by Bobby Farrelly, Peter Farrelly. With Drew Barrymore, Jimmy Fallon, Jason Spevack, Jack Kehler. Lindsay is stuck in the middle of her relationship with Ben and his passion for the Boston Red Sox." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0332047/","name":"Fever Pitch","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTMyNTE4ODA2N15BMl5BanBnXkFtZTcwNzg5ODUyMw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Lindsay is stuck in the middle of her relationship with Ben and his passion for the Boston Red Sox.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0332047/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Barky44"},"dateCreated":"2005-04-17","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Decent Enough Distraction","reviewBody":"Fever Pitch is a fun enough movie. It has a lot of funny moments (including a hilariously disturbing shower scene). Like most romantic comedies, it has a "dead zone" in the middle where all the heavy, "she's breaking up with me" stuff happens, but other than that it continues to be funny until the end.

Even though the plot revolves around fanaticism towards the Red Sox, it's not overloaded with sports. You don't have to be a fan to enjoy this film.

Of course that's easy for me to say: I've been a Red Sox fan since I was a boy, too.

7 out of 10.

Barky","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":44417,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Drama","Romance"],"datePublished":"2005-04-08","keywords":"baseball sport,boston red sox,baltimore orioles,world series,ups","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Fever Pitch","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4121297177","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThhYWEwMzctOGFjZS00NDI0LWJjNzktZTdiNDMwNjliN2E3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZThhYWEwMzctOGFjZS00NDI0LWJjNzktZTdiNDMwNjliN2E3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzU1NzE3NTg@._V1_.jpg","description":"Home Video Trailer from 20th Century Fox"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000106/","name":"Drew Barrymore"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0266422/","name":"Jimmy Fallon"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1555151/","name":"Jason Spevack"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0125803/","name":"Bobby Farrelly"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0268380/","name":"Peter Farrelly"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0017497/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0148520/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0005838/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0304665/","name":"Lowell Ganz"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0541632/","name":"Babaloo Mandel"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0394984/","name":"Nick Hornby"}],"duration":"PT1H44M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Fantastic Four
Fantastyczna Czwórka
Fantastic Four
programme.desc:
Fantastic Four: Directed by Josh Trank, Stephen E. Rivkin. With Miles Teller, Michael B. Jordan, Kate Mara, Jamie Bell. Four young outsiders teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe which alters their physical form in shocking ways. The four must learn to harness their new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned enemy." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1502712/","name":"Fantastic Four","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTk0OTMyMDA0OF5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzY5NTkzNTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four young outsiders teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe which alters their physical form in shocking ways. The four must learn to harness their new abilities and work together to save Earth from a former friend turned en","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1502712/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"charzhino"},"dateCreated":"2015-08-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"Too dark for its own good","reviewBody":"I went into this movie with hope and optimism and not put off by the negative light shone towards it. An hour and 40 minutes later, I left feeling empty and unsatisfied. Comic book films are supposed to make you feel inspired, but not this one. 

So what is wrong with it? One word – chemistry. In any superhero team/ensemble there should be great character interactions and a feeling that these guys can effectively make a team, never mind a ''fantastic'' team. The best team movies all have characters playing off each other as in the Avengers and X-Men. However, there is zero chemistry between any of the F4. We see an attempt at some early romance between Reed and Sue which doesn't go anywhere. Johnny Storm is billed as a genius but troubled kid however we never see why he has a high IQ, he is just shifted in to make up the numbers. We never see him form any sustainable bond with any of the others. Ben Grimm also appears as an outsider, brought in with little sense to the project to fill the final slot. The chemistry between the original F4 (2005) was MUCH better whereas here they feel like 4 individuals. 

 

The climatic battle takes place in the most boring environment that you can imagine. It is over within 10 minutes, with not much ingenuity to overcome a half decent attempt at Dr Doom, who at first seems very intimidating. This film will be quickly forgotten and the question isn't whether a sequel will be made or whether it will cross over with X-Men, but is the original Fantastic 4 film a better watch than this depressing, dull comic book movie. Final score 5.5/10","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":5}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":160188,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.2},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Action","Adventure","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2015-08-05","keywords":"troubled production,marvel comics,fantastic four,invisibility,superhero team","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Theatrical Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi3166483225","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTczNDc3OTkxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTY5ODUyNjE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTczNDc3OTkxMV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMTY5ODUyNjE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Four young outsiders teleport to an alternate and dangerous universe which alters their physical form in shocking ways. programme.title: Braveheart
Po horyzont
Horizon Line
programme.desc:
Braveheart: Directed by Mel Gibson. With James Robinson, Sean Lawlor, Sandy Nelson, James Cosmo. Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0112573/","name":"Braveheart","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzkzMmU0YTYtOWM3My00YzBmLWI0YzctOGYyNTkwMWE5MTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0112573/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"heisenberg12"},"dateCreated":"2019-08-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's a Masterpiece. Best Movie of All Time","reviewBody":"Braveheart is the best movie ever made in history, an absolute sculpted work of art that depicts every emotion of human existence, from suffering, to courage to love, in front of the background of political astuteness and socio-hierarchal analysis.

Telling the quasi-true story of one man's conviction and courage to exact vengeance for the killing of his first wife and father at the hands of the ruthless King Edward the II of England, who in turn inspires his small province of Scotland to rebel and go to war in a real fight for freedom and independence, Braveheart is a stunning depiction of the capacity of the human spirit to overcome the odds, defy tyranny, and achieve justice, respect, and dignity against oppression.

Although its retractors and critics will dwell and harp on the historical accuracy of some of the movie, particularly what part Robert the Bruce played in real life, there is no denying the true power and emotional influence of this movie. It's understandable, particularly for Europeans, how this could be problematic due to their upbringing in studying history, but the movie is not really about being historically perfect; it's a work of art about things much deeper. A documentary it is not, and it's duplistic and hypocritical for the film's haters to dwell on this minor detail, but perhaps allow historical rewriting to slide and give it a free pass in something like Tarantino's Inglourious Basterds or Once Upon a Time in Hollywood.

On this topic, one of the dozens of best parts in the movie is when Robert the Bruce plays an important role in one of the battles, and eventually the movie does come around and get Robert's history back on track with more accuracy as to his part and character in the battle for Scotland's independence.

Without trying to get the history perfect, this movie is simply flawless. It's beyond flawless, really. A flawless movie can just be a technical masterpiece with very little power, but the raw power and emotion coming off the screen in practically every single scene in Braveheart is like an inferno.

James Horner's score is one of the greatest scores ever for any movie, and it successfully enhances the drama and emotion of each scene, without coming across as manipulative. It fits perfectly into every single scene it is used.

There isn't one acting role that is not well-done. This is one of Gibson's best acting roles, and the guy who plays Edward II gives an outstanding performance.

This is the greatest epic movie ever created in the history of Hollywood. A few years later, another great modern epic Gladiator came out and drew rightful comparisons to Braveheart, but while Gladiator is a very good movie, it lacks in the emotional depth, power, and ultimate inspiration behind the experience of watching Braveheart.

The final Act of Braveheart is one of the most powerful ever put on film. As a first time viewer, you really have no idea where the story is going to go (even as a repeat viewer it still holds weight). To this day, there is still nothing like it. Just when you think it's over or you know how it will end, it just continues to twist and turn, and then it closes with what is probably the best ending of any movie in history.

In addition to all of this, the body of Braveheart is loaded with outstanding battle scenes, incredible editing, and great dialogue rooted in inspiration, political strategy, philosophy, and stunning human experience of love, desire, passion, suffering, and identity.

When you look at the top rated movies on IMDB, it is laughable that comic book movies and good popcorn-fun movies are actually rated above this. This is without a doubt, hands down, one of the top 25 movies ever made, and in my opinion, it is the #1 best movie of all-time.

This movie is a masterpiece.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":998140,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"1995-05-24","keywords":"scotland,revolt,legend,secret marriage,historically inaccurate","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2874063641","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmIyZmUwMjgtMjU4OC00MDgxLWIxZWEtODM4NjcwZTJjYTVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmIyZmUwMjgtMjU4OC00MDgxLWIxZWEtODM4NjcwZTJjYTVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":""},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000521/","name":"Sophie Marceau"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001526/","name":"Patrick McGoohan"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000700/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042559/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078539/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0908824/","name":"Randall Wallace"}],"duration":"PT2H58M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.review: --- Actors: James Robinson (role=Young William), Sean Lawlor (role=Malcolm Wallace), Sandy Nelson (role=John Wallace), James Cosmo (role=Campbell), Sean McGinley (role=MacClannough), Alan Tall (role=Elder Stewart), Andrew Weir (role=Young Hamish), Gerda Stevenson (role=Mother MacClannough), Ralph Riach (role=Priest No. 1), Mhairi Calvey (role=Young Murron), Brian Cox (role=Argyle Wallace), Patrick McGoohan (role=Longshanks - King Edward I)

IMDb data; ttnr: 0112573, Title: Braveheart, --- Description: Braveheart: Directed by Mel Gibson. With James Robinson, Sean Lawlor, Sandy Nelson, James Cosmo. Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt0112573/","name":"Braveheart","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMzkzMmU0YTYtOWM3My00YzBmLWI0YzctOGYyNTkwMWE5MTJkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyNzkwMjQ5NzM@._V1_.jpg","description":"Scottish warrior William Wallace leads his countrymen in a rebellion to free his homeland from the tyranny of King Edward I of England.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt0112573/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"heisenberg12","dateCreated":"2019-08-04","inLanguage":"English","name":"It's a Masterpiece. Best Movie of All Time","reviewBody":"Braveheart is the best movie ever made in history, an absolute sculpted work of art that depicts every emotion of human existence, from suffering, to courage to love, in front of the background of political astuteness and socio-hierarchal analysis.

Telling the quasi-true story of one man's conviction and courage to exact vengeance for the killing of his first wife and father at the hands of the ruthless King Edward the II of England, who in turn inspires his small province of Scotland to rebel and go to war in a real fight for freedom and independence, Braveheart is a stunning depiction of the capacity of the human spirit to overcome the odds, defy tyranny, and achieve justice, respect, and dignity against oppression.

Although its retractors and critics will dwell and harp on the historical accuracy of some of the movie, particularly what part Robert the Bruce played in real life, there is no denying the true power and emotional influence of this movie. It's understandable, particularly for Europeans, how this could be problematic due to their upbringing in studying history, but the movie is not really about being historically perfect; it's a work of art about things much deeper. A documentary it is not, and it's duplistic and hypocritical for the film's haters to dwell on this minor detail, but perhaps allow historical rewriting to slide and give it a free pass in something like Tarantino's Inglourious Basterds or Once Upon a Time in Hollywood.

On this topic, one of the dozens of best parts in the movie is when Robert the Bruce plays an important role in one of the battles, and eventually the movie does come around and get Robert's history back on track with more accuracy as to his part and character in the battle for Scotland's independence.

Without trying to get the history perfect, this movie is simply flawless. It's beyond flawless, really. A flawless movie can just be a technical masterpiece with very little power, but the raw power and emotion coming off the screen in practically every single scene in Braveheart is like an inferno.

James Horner's score is one of the greatest scores ever for any movie, and it successfully enhances the drama and emotion of each scene, without coming across as manipulative. It fits perfectly into every single scene it is used.

There isn't one acting role that is not well-done. This is one of Gibson's best acting roles, and the guy who plays Edward II gives an outstanding performance.

This is the greatest epic movie ever created in the history of Hollywood. A few years later, another great modern epic Gladiator came out and drew rightful comparisons to Braveheart, but while Gladiator is a very good movie, it lacks in the emotional depth, power, and ultimate inspiration behind the experience of watching Braveheart.

The final Act of Braveheart is one of the most powerful ever put on film. As a first time viewer, you really have no idea where the story is going to go (even as a repeat viewer it still holds weight). To this day, there is still nothing like it. Just when you think it's over or you know how it will end, it just continues to twist and turn, and then it closes with what is probably the best ending of any movie in history.

In addition to all of this, the body of Braveheart is loaded with outstanding battle scenes, incredible editing, and great dialogue rooted in inspiration, political strategy, philosophy, and stunning human experience of love, desire, passion, suffering, and identity.

When you look at the top rated movies on IMDB, it is laughable that comic book movies and good popcorn-fun movies are actually rated above this. This is without a doubt, hands down, one of the top 25 movies ever made, and in my opinion, it is the #1 best movie of all-time.

This movie is a masterpiece.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":10,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":998140,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":8.3,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama","History"],"datePublished":"1995-05-24","keywords":"scotland,revolt,legend,secret marriage,historically inaccurate","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2874063641","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmIyZmUwMjgtMjU4OC00MDgxLWIxZWEtODM4NjcwZTJjYTVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmIyZmUwMjgtMjU4OC00MDgxLWIxZWEtODM4NjcwZTJjYTVkXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRodW1ibmFpbC1pbml0aWFsaXplcg@@._V1_.jpg","description":"","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000521/","name":"Sophie Marceau","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0001526/","name":"Patrick McGoohan"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000154/","name":"Mel Gibson"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000700/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0042559/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0078539/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0908824/","name":"Randall Wallace"],"duration":"PT2H58M"</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Kingsman: The Secret Service
Kingsman: Tajne służby
Kingsman: The Secret Service
programme.desc:
Kingsman: The Secret Service: Directed by Matthew Vaughn. With Adrian Quinton, Colin Firth, Mark Strong, Jonno Davies. A spy organisation recruits a promising street kid into the agency's training program, while a global threat emerges from a twisted tech genius." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2802144/","name":"Kingsman: The Secret Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTM3ZTllNzItNTNmOS00NzJiLTg1MWMtMjMxNDc0NmJhODU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A spy organisation recruits a promising street kid into the agency's training program, while a global threat emerges from a twisted tech genius.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2802144/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ethanmidd"},"dateCreated":"2015-02-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Fun Throwback Spy Movie","reviewBody":"Matthew Vaughn is now one of those directors that I can trust. This is my third movie I've seen by him and he still has not disappointed me. I remember when I first saw Kick Ass and was blown away with how great it is (probably in my top 25). 

This film is a big shout out (basically) to old spy films. It has everything: women, awesome fight scenes, gadgets, and even a ridiculous villain. Samuel L. Jackson plays the villain in this movie, and it's nice because we usually don't see him in that role. He also had a lisp in the entire movie so almost everything he said would make me chuckle. There's also a girl who has blades for feet, which is outrageous but because how Vaughn did an excellent job with choreographing fight scenes, her role worked really well into the film. It's the same for Jackson's character.

The action scenes in general were fantastic. Like I said in the last paragraph, the choreography is very well done. This is also because of the smooth editing and shots Vaughn chose for all of the fight scenes. It's a very fun thing to see.

There really aren't any huge gripes for this movie. The only small thing that I can think of is I wish there was a bit more of Cookson's character in the third act. 

Kingsman is a fun spy thriller movie that had me laughing many times and also had more than a few boundary-pushing moments. However it all worked because of the smooth editing and well-choreographed scenes along with great acting from the entire cast. If you are looking for a good popcorn movie to see, this is a movie you should see with your pals.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":625090,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-01-29","keywords":"spy,female rear nudity,training,class differences,secret organization","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1901244185","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzk1MTc4NDE2NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQxMjY1MzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzk1MTc4NDE2NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQxMjY1MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A super-secret spy organization recruits an unrefined but promising street kid into the agency's ultra-competitive training program just as a global threat emerges from a twisted tech genius."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000147/","name":"Colin Firth"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5473782/","name":"Taron Egerton"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000168/","name":"Samuel L. Jackson"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891216/","name":"Matthew Vaughn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0000756/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0165404/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0541631/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0963359/","name":"Jane Goldman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0891216/","name":"Matthew Vaughn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2092839/","name":"Mark Millar"}],"duration":"PT2H9M"}</script><metacontent="

A spy organisation recruits a promising street kid into the agency's training program, while a global threat emerges from a twisted tech genius." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt2802144/","name":"Kingsman: The Secret Service","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYTM3ZTllNzItNTNmOS00NzJiLTg1MWMtMjMxNDc0NmJhODU5XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyODE5NzE3OTE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A spy organisation recruits a promising street kid into the agency's training program, while a global threat emerges from a twisted tech genius.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt2802144/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"ethanmidd","dateCreated":"2015-02-25","inLanguage":"English","name":"A Fun Throwback Spy Movie","reviewBody":"Matthew Vaughn is now one of those directors that I can trust. This is my third movie I've seen by him and he still has not disappointed me. I remember when I first saw Kick Ass and was blown away with how great it is (probably in my top 25). 

This film is a big shout out (basically) to old spy films. It has everything: women, awesome fight scenes, gadgets, and even a ridiculous villain. Samuel L. Jackson plays the villain in this movie, and it's nice because we usually don't see him in that role. He also had a lisp in the entire movie so almost everything he said would make me chuckle. There's also a girl who has blades for feet, which is outrageous but because how Vaughn did an excellent job with choreographing fight scenes, her role worked really well into the film. It's the same for Jackson's character.

The action scenes in general were fantastic. Like I said in the last paragraph, the choreography is very well done. This is also because of the smooth editing and shots Vaughn chose for all of the fight scenes. It's a very fun thing to see.

There really aren't any huge gripes for this movie. The only small thing that I can think of is I wish there was a bit more of Cookson's character in the third act. 

Kingsman is a fun spy thriller movie that had me laughing many times and also had more than a few boundary-pushing moments. However it all worked because of the smooth editing and well-choreographed scenes along with great acting from the entire cast. If you are looking for a good popcorn movie to see, this is a movie you should see with your pals.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":625090,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.7,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Adventure","Comedy"],"datePublished":"2015-01-29","keywords":"spy,female rear nudity,training,class differences,secret organization","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"International Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1901244185","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzk1MTc4NDE2NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQxMjY1MzE@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNzk1MTc4NDE2NV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwNzQxMjY1MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A super-secret spy organization recruits an unrefined but promising street kid into the agency's ultra-competitive training program just as a global threat emerges from a twisted tech genius.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000147/","name":"Colin Firth","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm5473782/","name":"Taron Egerton","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000168/","name":"Samuel L. programme.title: You May Kiss the Bridesmaid
Możesz pocałować druhnę
You May Kiss the Bridesmaid
programme.desc: You May Kiss the Bridesmaid: Directed by Caroline Labrèche. With Tori Anderson, Kristopher Turner, Julia Borsellino, Sarah Orenstein. Food influencer Scarlett Bailey is presented with the opportunity of a lifetime to work as a pastry chef in one of NYC's top restaurants. Her life gets put on hold when she returns to her hometown for her sister Maddie's wedding. Scarlett learns that her parents have sold the family home, a B&B, to her childhood flame Liam Perry and that Maddie has lost her wedding venue days before the nuptials. Scarlett suggests they host the event at the B&B and works with Liam to pull off the wedding of Maddie's dreams, trying to put their history behind them. As her dream job in NYC becomes a firm offer, Scarlett is forced to make a decision. She has been falling back in love with Liam and with her childhood home. With the countdown to the wedding day on, will Liam Perry get to kiss the bridesmaid?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12829388/","name":"You May Kiss the Bridesmaid","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI3MTQwNzgtYmIzNy00YWI3LWIxMGEtYmE5YmU1YmVmN2RmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk1NzUwMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Food influencer Scarlett Bailey is presented with the opportunity of a lifetime to work as a pastry chef in one of NYC's top restaurants. programme.title: Palm Springs
Palm Springs
programme.desc:
Palm Springs: Directed by Max Barbakow. With Andy Samberg, Cristin Milioti, J.K. Simmons, Peter Gallagher. Stuck in a time loop, two wedding guests develop a budding romance while living the same day over and over again." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9484998/","name":"Palm Springs","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjk0MTgzMmQtZmY2My00NmE5LWExNGUtYjZkNTA3ZDkyMTJiXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Stuck in a time loop, two wedding guests develop a budding romance while living the same day over and over again.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9484998/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"Mary444"},"dateCreated":"2020-07-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Delightful, sweet, and charming","reviewBody":"Ha! This movie is bold, sweet, and funny!

I'm 65 years old and generally a prude when it comes to sex and violence. But this was a charmingly-delightful experience into a clever time-loop snafu, so I got over the cartoon sex and cartoon violence.

Andy Samberg captures some of Bill Murray's frustration in Groundhog Day but then makes it charmingly his own. Andy is exhausted but then added into the mix is the captivating Cristin Milioti. And then things just take off in a bizarre way.

The bar dance was mesmerizing and hilarious. Bonus points for the great J.K Simmons who stole every scene he was in. Bonus points for the amazing chemistry of Samberg and Milioti.

I'll let the rest of the reviewers discuss direction, set design, editing, and cinematography - but all were perfect.

In a normal year, this film would've garnered many academy award nominations. Maybe Best Picture would've gone to such a unique comedy. Who knows how the 2020 AA will shake out but this movie is just charming and delightful. Watch and enjoy! It's laugh-out-loud fun and just so sweet.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":139481,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7.4},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Comedy","Fantasy","Mystery"],"datePublished":"2020-07-10","keywords":"time loop,stuck in a time loop,day repeats itself,unable to die,wedding","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4230397465","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWZhZjY4ZGEtMGE3ZS00NTA3LTlmYzgtOTJjMGMxYWJmMWU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNWZhZjY4ZGEtMGE3ZS00NTA3LTlmYzgtOTJjMGMxYWJmMWU1XkEyXkFqcGdeQWRvb2xpbmhk._V1_.jpg","description":"When carefree Nyles (Andy Samberg) and reluctant maid of honor Sarah (Cristin Milioti) have a chance encounter at a Palm Springs wedding, things get complicated when they find themselves unable to escape the venue, themselves, or each other."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1676221/","name":"Andy Samberg"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm2129662/","name":"Cristin Milioti"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0799777/","name":"J.K. Simmons"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3817317/","name":"Max Barbakow"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0338811/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0382817/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0191796/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4460791/","name":"Andy Siara"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3817317/","name":"Max Barbakow"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Bombshell
Gorący temat
Bombshell
programme.desc:
Bombshell: Directed by Jay Roach. With Charlize Theron, Nicole Kidman, Margot Robbie, John Lithgow. A group of women take on Fox News head Roger Ailes and the toxic atmosphere he presided over at the network." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6394270/","name":"Bombshell","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjlhOWE3YjktY2MzOC00ZmQ1LWIwNjgtZmVhZmFjZGExMzgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of women take on Fox News head Roger Ailes and the toxic atmosphere he presided over at the network.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6394270/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"olivewahh"},"dateCreated":"2020-01-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A powerful and enjoyable film","reviewBody":"I didn't know much on this story when it all happened, possibly cause I'm based in Australia and it was an American scandal, but the whole story is so powerful and should be shared across the globe.

When Gretchen Carlson (Nicole Kidman) is let go from her job at Fox News, she sues the CEO, Roger Ailes (John Lithgow), for sexual harassment. Going up against a powerful man in a even more powerful company, Gretchen seeks help from other female employees to come forward and speak up and make an end to this man.

I really enjoyed this film, but felt I could've enjoyed it even more if I knew more about the story when it was happening. In saying that, it didn't make the film confusing or bad in any form. It's a powerful story that needs to be shared for how woman can be treated in the workplace and hopefully spreads the message that inappropriate sexual behaviour is never acceptable and should be spoken up about.

Nicole, Charlize and Margot were all so damn good in this film. Three incredible ladies. I would've liked to have seen a bit more on Margot's character, but I then learnt after that her character isn't part of the real life scandal.

This is a great movie to start off the new year.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":106956,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-12-20","keywords":"photograph,republican party,scandal,tv news,sexual harassment","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"New Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2331492121","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWEyMTkyMDAtMDkwNC00Zjk3LTk5ZGQtZmY1MTIxMGUwY2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWEyMTkyMDAtMDkwNC00Zjk3LTk5ZGQtZmY1MTIxMGUwY2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Bombshell - In theaters December 2019. Charlize Theron, Nicole Kidman, Margot Robbie, John Lithgow, Kate McKinnon, Connie Britton, Mark Duplass, Rob Delaney, Malcolm McDowell, Allison Janney."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000234/","name":"Charlize Theron"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000173/","name":"Nicole Kidman"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3053338/","name":"Margot Robbie"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0005366/","name":"Jay Roach"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0465018/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0323215/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0309252/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1017488/","name":"Charles Randolph"}],"duration":"PT1H49M"}</script><metacontent="

A group of women take on Fox News head Roger Ailes and the toxic atmosphere he presided over at the network." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt6394270/","name":"Bombshell","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjlhOWE3YjktY2MzOC00ZmQ1LWIwNjgtZmVhZmFjZGExMzgyXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMDA4NzMyOA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A group of women take on Fox News head Roger Ailes and the toxic atmosphere he presided over at the network.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt6394270/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"olivewahh","dateCreated":"2020-01-16","inLanguage":"English","name":"A powerful and enjoyable film","reviewBody":"I didn't know much on this story when it all happened, possibly cause I'm based in Australia and it was an American scandal, but the whole story is so powerful and should be shared across the globe.

When Gretchen Carlson (Nicole Kidman) is let go from her job at Fox News, she sues the CEO, Roger Ailes (John Lithgow), for sexual harassment. Going up against a powerful man in a even more powerful company, Gretchen seeks help from other female employees to come forward and speak up and make an end to this man.

I really enjoyed this film, but felt I could've enjoyed it even more if I knew more about the story when it was happening. In saying that, it didn't make the film confusing or bad in any form. It's a powerful story that needs to be shared for how woman can be treated in the workplace and hopefully spreads the message that inappropriate sexual behaviour is never acceptable and should be spoken up about.

Nicole, Charlize and Margot were all so damn good in this film. Three incredible ladies. I would've liked to have seen a bit more on Margot's character, but I then learnt after that her character isn't part of the real life scandal.

This is a great movie to start off the new year.","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":8,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":106956,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.8,"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Drama"],"datePublished":"2019-12-20","keywords":"photograph,republican party,scandal,tv news,sexual harassment","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"New Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2331492121","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWEyMTkyMDAtMDkwNC00Zjk3LTk5ZGQtZmY1MTIxMGUwY2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWEyMTkyMDAtMDkwNC00Zjk3LTk5ZGQtZmY1MTIxMGUwY2I2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Bombshell - In theaters December 2019. programme.desc: Follow Me: Directed by Will Wernick. With Keegan Allen, Holland Roden, Denzel Whitaker, Ronen Rubinstein. A social media personality travels with his friends to Moscow to capture new content for his successful VLOG. Always pushing the limits and catering to a growing audience, they enter a cold world of mystery, excess, and danger." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt8160834/","name":"Follow Me","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BYjU4ZTlkN2MtOGJlNS00ZWE1LWFmYjUtNTY3MDBhZjgwZjQ3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjA1MzQyNDE@._V1_.jpg","description":"A social media personality travels with his friends to Moscow to capture new content for his successful VLOG. The second half just wants to be a poor remake of Hostel and Saw. I don't want there to be any spoilers in my review, but let's just say the ending could REALLY have been better. programme.title: Sobel - koncert
programme.desc: Finałowy koncert trasy "Pułapka na motyle" Sobla, znanego polskiego rapera. Wydarzenie we wrocławskiej Hali Stulecia obejrzało 5 tysięcy osób. Artysta zaprezentował nowe aranżacje utworów, a jego występ uświetniły pokazy pirotechniczne oraz goście specjalni. Na scenie stawili się m.in. Young Igi, Oki, Piotrek Lewandowski (współtwórca singli "Fiołkowe pole" i "Każdego dnia") oraz Michał Szczygieł.

programme.title: Fascinatrix
programme.desc: Oskarżona o bycie wiedźmą Dorota (Joanna Drozda) ucieka przed Inkwizycją. Następnie, żądna zemsty, powraca na zamek, z którego została wygnana, w przebraniu łowcy czarownic. Krótkometrażowy musical Justyny Mytnik, nagrodzony m.in. na Świdnickim Festiwalu Filmowym "Spektrum" w 2018 roku.

programme.title: You May Kiss the Bridesmaid
Możesz pocałować druhnę
You May Kiss the Bridesmaid
programme.desc: You May Kiss the Bridesmaid: Directed by Caroline Labrèche. With Tori Anderson, Kristopher Turner, Julia Borsellino, Sarah Orenstein. Food influencer Scarlett Bailey is presented with the opportunity of a lifetime to work as a pastry chef in one of NYC's top restaurants. Her life gets put on hold when she returns to her hometown for her sister Maddie's wedding. Scarlett learns that her parents have sold the family home, a B&B, to her childhood flame Liam Perry and that Maddie has lost her wedding venue days before the nuptials. Scarlett suggests they host the event at the B&B and works with Liam to pull off the wedding of Maddie's dreams, trying to put their history behind them. As her dream job in NYC becomes a firm offer, Scarlett is forced to make a decision. She has been falling back in love with Liam and with her childhood home. With the countdown to the wedding day on, will Liam Perry get to kiss the bridesmaid?" data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt12829388/","name":"You May Kiss the Bridesmaid","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOWI3MTQwNzgtYmIzNy00YWI3LWIxMGEtYmE5YmU1YmVmN2RmXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTk1NzUwMA@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Food influencer Scarlett Bailey is presented with the opportunity of a lifetime to work as a pastry chef in one of NYC's top restaurants. programme.title: Diana - księżna, która przyćmiła Koronę
programme.desc: Dokument jest poświęcony życiu i spuściźnie księżnej Diany. Kobieta będąca tragiczną ikoną brytyjskiej monarchii nadal budzi ciekawość czy fascynację, mimo że od jej przedwczesnej śmieci mijają kolejne lata. Autorzy filmu starają się spojrzeć na historię swej bohaterki z nowej perspektywy, korzystając z informacji pochodzących od byłego kamerdynera, a także zaufanego biografa.

programme.desc: The Prince of Egypt: Directed by Brenda Chapman, Steve Hickner, Simon Wells. With Val Kilmer, Ralph Fiennes, Michelle Pfeiffer, Sandra Bullock. programme.title: Send It

Send It!
programme.desc: Send It!: Directed by Andrew Stevens. With Kevin Quinn, Claudia Lee, Patrick Fabian, Michael Jai White. An extreme sportsman's life forever changes upon departing his simple Texas roots to compete in the world's most prestigious Kiteboarding Championship. Along the way, an edgy street-smart girl challenges him well beyond just kiting." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9009826/","name":"Send It!","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BOTg3MjY2MGEtZDIzYS00YjAzLTk1ODUtYjMzNGQ4NDkxNjM3XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyOTg4MDYyNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An extreme sportsman's life forever changes upon departing his simple Texas roots to compete in the world's most prestigious Kiteboarding Championship. Along the way, an edgy street-smart girl challenges him well beyond just kiting.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9009826/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kennyk00"},"dateCreated":"2021-05-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"Is pretty unwatchable unless you're a teenager","reviewBody":"Review by kahalilsekkat is pretty accurate. Very fictional and comical teenage movie that is tough to watch as an action/sport film, can't help but to laugh & shake my head. programme.title: Love, Weddings & Other Disasters
Miłość, ślub i inne nieszczęścia
Love, Weddings & Other Disasters
programme.desc: Love, Weddings & Other Disasters: Directed by Dennis Dugan. With Maggie Grace, Jeremy Irons, Diane Keaton, Diego Boneta. It is a multi-story romantic comedy about the people who work on weddings to create the perfect day for a loving couple - while their own relationships are outlandish, odd, crazy and far from perfect." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10235718/","name":"Love, Weddings & Other Disasters","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BODA5NzRjMDktMzc0My00NDdkLThlN2YtNDZiYjM3MGVkY2M4XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTEyMjM2NDc2._V1_.jpg","description":"It is a multi-story romantic comedy about the people who work on weddings to create the perfect day for a loving couple - while their own relationships are outlandish, odd, crazy and far from perfect.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10235718/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"vovers1"},"dateCreated":"2021-03-13","inLanguage":"English","name":"They pulled it off don't believe the trashy reviews","reviewBody":"Yes it is a cheesy, contrived, feel good wedding movie. Yet somehow the team pulls it off, don't expect anything deep or meaningful, just take it for what it is, a feel good piece of entertainment to make us happy and the production crew a salary. Probably a pretty good one.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":6}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":1676,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":5},"contentRating":"PG-13","genre":["Comedy","Romance"],"datePublished":"2020-12-04","keywords":"couple","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi4041982233","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFjNTQxNGEtMjEzNS00ZjI1LTg1OTYtOTRlNmI0NzNkY2YwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMjFjNTQxNGEtMjEzNS00ZjI1LTg1OTYtOTRlNmI0NzNkY2YwXkEyXkFqcGdeQXRyYW5zY29kZS13b3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Maggie Grace (Taken) and Oscar® winners Diane Keaton and Jeremy Irons lead this warmhearted romantic comedy. With a couple’s impending wedding as the backdrop, Love, Weddings & Other Disasters weaves multiple storylines as it follows the search for love by a colorful group of characters including: an inexperienced wedding planner (Grace) nicknamed “The Wedding Trasher”; a fussy celebrity caterer (Irons); his blind date (Keaton); and a tour-bus guide (Andrew Bachelor) looking for his Cinderella. How their lives and loves intersect is half the fun in this film that proves romance is alive and well… and as crazy as ever!"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1192254/","name":"Maggie Grace"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000460/","name":"Jeremy Irons"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000473/","name":"Diane Keaton"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240797/","name":"Dennis Dugan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0754311/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0447556/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0810439/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0174885/","name":"Eileen Conn"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0240797/","name":"Dennis Dugan"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0588777/","name":"Larry Miller"}],"duration":"PT1H36M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Danny Collins
Idol
Danny Collins
programme.desc: Danny Collins: Directed by Dan Fogelman. With Al Pacino, Annette Bening, Jennifer Garner, Bobby Cannavale. An aging rock star decides to change his life when he discovers a 40-year-old letter written to him by John Lennon." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1772288/","name":"Danny Collins","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDk5NTYxOTk2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzIxMjE0MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An aging rock star decides to change his life when he discovers a 40-year-old letter written to him by John Lennon.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1772288/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"billcurry-1"},"dateCreated":"2015-04-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Intellectually and Emotionally Stimulating Film","reviewBody":"Because this film is intellectually and emotionally stimulating in a subtle way, I had to drive 65 miles, from Lafayette to Baton Rouge, where it was in was in one compartment of a multiplex. That the compartment was Number Nine was a nice touch. But New Orleans had it in three theaters. My review: I enjoyed it. Been a fan of Pacino since Dog Day Afternoon, Plummer since Sound of Music, Lennon since fall, 1963. And I've never seen a movie with Annette Bening that I didn't' like. The script was good; I didn't see anything not to like. So why didn't the movie come to me rather than vice versa? Apparently, the theater owners where I live won't bet on a movie without car chases, guns, shooting, war, all sorts of violence, or juvenile, senseless humor, or mainstream sports. Perhaps a little thriller/horror/sci-fi/blockbuster (Titanic, JFK) might seep through. The sad thing is they may be right. A movie devoid of the aforementioned criteria might lose money here."},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":31064,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":7},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Biography","Comedy","Drama"],"datePublished":"2015-04-10","keywords":"boyfriend girlfriend relationship,f word,doctor,blog,reference to mike nichols and elaine may","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Trailer #1","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi343846681","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3Njk4ODU0Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODUzMTc0MzE@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTU3Njk4ODU0Nl5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwODUzMTc0MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"Aging 1970s rocker Danny Collins can't give up his hard-living ways, but when his manager uncovers a 40-year-old undelivered letter written to him by John Lennon, he decides to change course and embarks on a heartfelt journey to rediscover his family, find true love, and begin a second act.\r\n"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000199/","name":"Al Pacino"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000906/","name":"Annette Bening"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0004950/","name":"Jennifer Garner"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1557594/","name":"Dan Fogelman"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0203259/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0485757/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1557594/","name":"Dan Fogelman"}],"duration":"PT1H46M"}</script><metacontent="

An aging rock star decides to change his life when he discovers a 40-year-old letter written to him by John Lennon." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt1772288/","name":"Danny Collins","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDk5NTYxOTk2MV5BMl5BanBnXkFtZTgwMzIxMjE0MzE@._V1_.jpg","description":"An aging rock star decides to change his life when he discovers a 40-year-old letter written to him by John Lennon.","review":"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt1772288/","author":"@type":"Person","name":"billcurry-1","dateCreated":"2015-04-15","inLanguage":"English","name":"Intellectually and Emotionally Stimulating Film","reviewBody":"Because this film is intellectually and emotionally stimulating in a subtle way, I had to drive 65 miles, from Lafayette to Baton Rouge, where it was in was in one compartment of a multiplex. That the compartment was Number Nine was a nice touch. But New Orleans had it in three theaters. My review: I enjoyed it. Been a fan of Pacino since Dog Day Afternoon, Plummer since Sound of Music, Lennon since fall, 1963. And I've never seen a movie with Annette Bening that I didn't' like. The script was good; I didn't see anything not to like. So why didn't the movie come to me rather than vice versa? Apparently, the theater owners where I live won't bet on a movie without car chases, guns, shooting, war, all sorts of violence, or juvenile, senseless humor, or mainstream sports. Perhaps a little thriller/horror/sci-fi/blockbuster (Titanic, JFK) might seep through. The sad thing is they may be right. A Modern take on the classic tale of Oliver Twist." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt10077034/","name":"Twist","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTI0Mjg3MzgtNTZiZC00ZmE2LWE4YTgtMDgwYThkMWM5MzY2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A Modern take on the classic tale of Oliver Twist.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt10077034/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"jonny-pears"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-10","inLanguage":"English","name":"Terrible","reviewBody":"I can honestly say this movie was hard to sit through. Then again there wasn't much to put effort towards. I'll be honest, most of the acting here was awful from Caine to Ora to Headley. Only Noel Clarke worked. Give this a miss. Another Sky production that fails to be worth it.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":2}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":2396,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":4.1},"contentRating":"R","genre":["Action","Drama"],"datePublished":"2021-01-29","keywords":"oliver twist,parkour,art gallery,art theft,graffiti","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2089992985","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDIyZDc2MmItNWY1Mi00M2IwLTk0ODMtYzNlYWFhOGZhMzBhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNDIyZDc2MmItNWY1Mi00M2IwLTk0ODMtYzNlYWFhOGZhMzBhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWxiaWFtb250._V1_.jpg","description":"Inspired by Charles Dickens's iconic novel OLIVER TWIST, this action-fueled crime-thriller set in contemporary London follows the journey of Twist (Raff Law), a gifted graffiti artist trying to find his way after the loss of his mother. Lured into a street gang headed by the paternal Fagin (Oscar® winner Michael Caine), Twist is attracted to the lifestyle - and to Red (Sophie Simnett), an alluring member of Fagin's crew. But when an art theft goes wrong, Twist's moral code is tested as he's caught between Fagin, the police, and a loose-cannon enforcer (Lena Headey)."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10823838/","name":"Dominic Di Tommaso"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0372176/","name":"Lena Headey"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm10356694/","name":"Samuel Leakey"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1966532/","name":"Martin Owen"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0687593/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0193056/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0744004/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1332311/","name":"John Wrathall"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm9840145/","name":"Sally Collett"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1213712/","name":"Matthew Parkhill"}],"duration":"PT1H30M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: To Your Last Death
Do ostatniej śmierci
To Your Last Death
programme.desc: To Your Last Death: Directed by Jason Axinn. With Morena Baccarin, William Shatner, Ray Wise, Bill Moseley. In order to save her siblings, a young woman takes on her father and the powerful entity known as Gamemaster, who ensnares humans into diabolical plots while her species gambles on the outcome." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt3748918/","name":"To Your Last Death","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZmQ3NGJmMmYtNzllZi00NDdlLTg3YmEtM2ZlYmI5ZjZmODJjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTQ1MzQyMjU@._V1_.jpg","description":"In order to save her siblings, a young woman takes on her father and the powerful entity known as Gamemaster, who ensnares humans into diabolical plots while her species gambles on the outcome.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt3748918/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"umimelectric"},"dateCreated":"2020-03-18","inLanguage":"English","name":"Cartoon bloodbath","reviewBody":"While not a masterpiece, how could anyone rate it only 1 star? That's confusing to me, as it seems a lot of care was put into producing this. Some people seem to have a problem with the animation, but I kind of like it. It's more of a comic-book art style full of gore and murder, and that appeals to me a lot more than Japanese animation does, even if the excessive blood isn't exactly what I look for in a movie. I'm not much for the torture porn, but this film balances it nicely with dark humor and an atmosphere of dread and anxiety. It's not going to be everyone's cup of tea but it's definitely not boring, and I give it 7/10 for at least being an original animated horror feature within the manhunt sub-genre, and not just another remake of something old.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":3574,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.1},"genre":["Animation","Action","Fantasy"],"datePublished":"2020-03-17","keywords":"blood,evil father,animated horror,female nudity,violence","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"To Your Last Death","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1666105113","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjc3YzU3YTUtYmVmMC00OGU5LWE1NGQtNjA2Mjk0ZThkNmIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BNjc3YzU3YTUtYmVmMC00OGU5LWE1NGQtNjA2Mjk0ZThkNmIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Official Trailer"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1072555/","name":"Morena Baccarin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0000638/","name":"William Shatner"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0936403/","name":"Ray Wise"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1494886/","name":"Jason Axinn"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0235544/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0162735/","name":"Jim Cirile"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1248511/","name":"Tanya C. programme.title: Eye Without a Face
Oko bez twarzy
Eye Without A Face
programme.desc:
Eye Without a Face: Directed by Ramin Niami. With Dakota Shapiro, Luke Cook, Vlada Verevko, Rebecca Berg. An agoraphobic young man (Henry), living with a Youtuber and struggling actor (Eric), hacks the webcams of young women, and suspects that one of them is a serial killer." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9543092/","name":"Eye Without a Face","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMWJjZjA5MDktODFkNi00ZWYxLThjMGEtYTcwYjc3ZTJhODE2XkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMjAwMDAyNw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"An agoraphobic young man (Henry), living with a Youtuber and struggling actor (Eric), hacks the webcams of young women, and suspects that one of them is a serial killer.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9543092/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"kuarinofu"},"dateCreated":"2021-08-11","inLanguage":"English","name":"Not as horrible as people say (still doesn't mean it's good)","reviewBody":"Eye Without a Face (2021) is definitely not a good movie, but it's not nearly as bad as IMDB reviews claim it to be.

I love to watch films that feel like they were made by an alien or an AI. This one is very much like it. It appears that they didn't know how human beings operate and what real life is in general.

It gets quite hilarious at times, like some of the "tense" scenes are legit funny. You can't make this stuff up intentionally.

The acting was mostly the film's strongest point. The Australian struggling actor was either a very well played character or an actual real-life struggling actor who was well-cast for the role.

The production was very light. It feels like this film was very cheap and efficient. We only get a couple of rooms and a quick walk capture, that's all.

At times bits and pieces of social commentary pop here and there, which is cool, but the film isn't really about that, unfortunately.

I love how the main lead lives in a jhuggi-type house, and I surely know why he does. You know his "computer skills" are just so high because he turns off his monitor each time he leaves. Or maybe it's all the scissors and pliers on the wall, together with a pair of old TV circuit boards.

I know I'm just making fun of this, but it's better this way. Believe me. You don't even want to try to understand how this story is supposed to work.","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":4}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":467,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":3.5},"genre":["Horror","Thriller"],"datePublished":"2021-08-10","keywords":"actor,subjective camera,spying,webcam,murder","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Eye Without a Face","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi1108066329","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QxMjBiNDMtZTk5OC00NTI3LWIyMTMtZDhkNGRlNzUzMTIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BY2QxMjBiNDMtZTk5OC00NTI3LWIyMTMtZDhkNGRlNzUzMTIxXkEyXkFqcGdeQVRoaXJkUGFydHlJbmdlc3Rpb25Xb3JrZmxvdw@@._V1_.jpg","description":"Trailer 1"},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4565981/","name":"Dakota Shapiro"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1981177/","name":"Luke Cook"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4031498/","name":"Vlada Verevko"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0629191/","name":"Ramin Niami"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0053741/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm0629191/","name":"Ramin Niami"}],"duration":"PT1H38M"}</script><metacontent="

programme.title: Little Fish
Chora pamięć
Little Fish
programme.desc:
Little Fish: Directed by Chad Hartigan. With Olivia Cooke, Jack O'Connell, Soko, Raúl Castillo. A couple fights to hold their relationship together as a memory loss virus spreads and threatens to erase the history of their love and courtship." data-id="main"/><script type="application/ld+json">{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"Movie","url":"/title/tt9735470/","name":"Little Fish","image":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BMTY1N2ZhMzktMThjZi00OWNhLWJhZjctMzEzNjQyOWIwZjBjXkEyXkFqcGdeQXVyMTkxNjUyNQ@@._V1_.jpg","description":"A couple fights to hold their relationship together as a memory loss virus spreads and threatens to erase the history of their love and courtship.","review":{"@type":"Review","itemReviewed":{"@type":"CreativeWork","url":"/title/tt9735470/"},"author":{"@type":"Person","name":"ferguson-6"},"dateCreated":"2021-02-05","inLanguage":"English","name":"on topic romance","reviewBody":"Greetings again from the darkness. In another time, it would be expected to label director Chad Hartigan's film as a science fiction romance. However, we aren't in another time - no matter how much we might wish we were. The story revolves around a global pandemic that is working its way ... unseen ... through society. Drug companies are frantically testing possible cures, while medical personnel are treating those afflicted as best they can. Sound a bit too familiar? Lest you judge too harshly as a quick cash-in, you should know the film was wrapped prior to the COVID-19 outbreak, so call it serendipity or pure luck, but the timing is impeccable.

It's called "NIA", an abbreviation for Neuro-Inflammatory Affliction. Those who get the virus lose their memories. Some experience a slow drop in their ability to recall, while it hits others like a quick slap. Newlyweds Emma (Olivia Cooke, SOUND OF METAL, THOROUGHBREDS) and Jude (Jack O'Connell, UNBROKEN, 2014) are our conduits to this world of fear, anxiety, and love. We experience their courtship through flashbacks, as the film is bookended by an Oceanside scene which makes no sense to us the first time, but certainly does at the end.

Mattson Tomlin adapted the screenplay from Aja Gabel's short story, and is also credited with the screenplay for the upcoming Matt Reeves movie THE BATMAN, starring Robert Pattinson. It's very well written and the two leads perform admirably. Ms. Cooke, in her native British accent, continues to shine in both her performances and choice of projects. Montages and flashbacks are used so that we have a feel for this relationship. Emma and Jude are the kind of couple who have an engagement fish, instead of a ring. They are both 'low-talkers', so you'll need to be tuned in, but the concern over the virus looms heavy over every character ... even memory tattoos are big business.

Other excellent movies dealing with memory include ETERNAL SUNSHINE OF THE SPOTLESS MIND (2004) and MEMENTO (2000), though Mr. Hartigan's movies is more similar in tone to the former than the latter. This is a romance with lots of hugging and tight holds. Emma asks, "How do you build a future when you keep having to rebuild the past?" We know that memories evolve and fade and change, but this NIA virus has us questioning if love is simply a bond held together by shared memories - and if the memories are gone, is the love gone as well? The movie is quite a downer to watch, and will very probably tug hard on your heartstrings; yet it's very well made and all too topical. Please excuse me if I refrain from using the science fiction label. In Theaters and On Demand on February 5, 2021","reviewRating":{"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7}},"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4088,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9},"contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Drama","Romance","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2021-02-05","keywords":"love","trailer":{"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2134032665","thumbnail":{"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjkwNzRlYmUtM2QxNC00ZWI4LWI2ZWQtYzM4Y2Q2MTQyNzhhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg"},"thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjkwNzRlYmUtM2QxNC00ZWI4LWI2ZWQtYzM4Y2Q2MTQyNzhhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"As a memory loss virus runs rampant, one couple fights to hold their relationship together before the disease can erase all memory of their love in this sweeping sci-fi romance."},"actor":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4972453/","name":"Olivia Cooke"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1925239/","name":"Jack O'Connell"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1331316/","name":"Soko"}],"director":[{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1029961/","name":"Chad Hartigan"}],"creator":[{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0323227/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319513/"},{"@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0439457/"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3231728/","name":"Mattson Tomlin"},{"@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3798172/","name":"Aja Gabel"}],"duration":"PT1H41M"}</script><metacontent="

The story revolves around a global pandemic that is working its way ... unseen ... through society. Drug companies are frantically testing possible cures, while medical personnel are treating those afflicted as best they can. Sound a bit too familiar? Lest you judge too harshly as a quick cash-in, you should know the film was wrapped prior to the COVID-19 outbreak, so call it serendipity or pure luck, but the timing is impeccable.

It's called "NIA", an abbreviation for Neuro-Inflammatory Affliction. Those who get the virus lose their memories. Some experience a slow drop in their ability to recall, while it hits others like a quick slap. Newlyweds Emma (Olivia Cooke, SOUND OF METAL, THOROUGHBREDS) and Jude (Jack O'Connell, UNBROKEN, 2014) are our conduits to this world of fear, anxiety, and love. We experience their courtship through flashbacks, as the film is bookended by an Oceanside scene which makes no sense to us the first time, but certainly does at the end.

Mattson Tomlin adapted the screenplay from Aja Gabel's short story, and is also credited with the screenplay for the upcoming Matt Reeves movie THE BATMAN, starring Robert Pattinson. It's very well written and the two leads perform admirably. Ms. Cooke, in her native British accent, continues to shine in both her performances and choice of projects. Montages and flashbacks are used so that we have a feel for this relationship. Emma and Jude are the kind of couple who have an engagement fish, instead of a ring. They are both 'low-talkers', so you'll need to be tuned in, but the concern over the virus looms heavy over every character ... even memory tattoos are big business.

Other excellent movies dealing with memory include ETERNAL SUNSHINE OF THE SPOTLESS MIND (2004) and MEMENTO (2000), though Mr. Hartigan's movies is more similar in tone to the former than the latter. This is a romance with lots of hugging and tight holds. Emma asks, "How do you build a future when you keep having to rebuild the past?" We know that memories evolve and fade and change, but this NIA virus has us questioning if love is simply a bond held together by shared memories - and if the memories are gone, is the love gone as well? The movie is quite a downer to watch, and will very probably tug hard on your heartstrings; yet it's very well made and all too topical. Please excuse me if I refrain from using the science fiction label. In Theaters and On Demand on February 5, 2021","reviewRating":"@type":"Rating","worstRating":1,"bestRating":10,"ratingValue":7,"aggregateRating":"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingCount":4088,"bestRating":10,"worstRating":1,"ratingValue":6.9,"contentRating":"Unrated","genre":["Drama","Romance","Sci-Fi"],"datePublished":"2021-02-05","keywords":"love","trailer":"@type":"VideoObject","name":"Official Trailer","embedUrl":"/video/imdb/vi2134032665","thumbnail":"@type":"ImageObject","contentUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjkwNzRlYmUtM2QxNC00ZWI4LWI2ZWQtYzM4Y2Q2MTQyNzhhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","thumbnailUrl":"https://m.media-amazon.com/images/M/MV5BZjkwNzRlYmUtM2QxNC00ZWI4LWI2ZWQtYzM4Y2Q2MTQyNzhhXkEyXkFqcGdeQWFybm8@._V1_.jpg","description":"As a memory loss virus runs rampant, one couple fights to hold their relationship together before the disease can erase all memory of their love in this sweeping sci-fi romance.","actor":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm4972453/","name":"Olivia Cooke","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1925239/","name":"Jack O'Connell","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1331316/","name":"Soko"],"director":["@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm1029961/","name":"Chad Hartigan"],"creator":["@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0323227/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0319513/","@type":"Organization","url":"/company/co0439457/","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3231728/","name":"Mattson Tomlin","@type":"Person","url":"/name/nm3798172/","name":"Aja Gabel"],"duration":"PT1H41M"</script><metacontent="
